text: This place is too good.there was lots of buffet and different type of food .food is soo tasty.prepration is soo good specially chicken tikka ,saag and dal makhni was too good .if anyone try to eat indian food I suggested this place .service was good it's very good Resturant

Mani is a beast.. pay him more $$. Dinner and a free magic show..Don't be dumb, eat here. best Indian food in Vegas. 

KEEMA MUTTER! GARLIC NAAN!

We ordered paneer kadhai, garlic naan, and chaai. The taste was very authentic. We tried paneer entrees in many Indian restaurants in the US but the  taste was compromised and never authentic.
The staff was very friendly , service was fast and yes, how can I forget the view of Lag Vegas airport with the famous Strip behind it!
Food quality , taste is very authentic and delicious - loved the staff courtesy which is rare to find -

Overall unimpressed with Pure Indian Cuisine. 

While the food was on par with any other Indian restaurant in town, the portion size and price did not adequately reflect the quality of the food. Indian food is a great lunch option mainly because of its price, size, variety, and healthiness. I ordered three dishes and three bottled waters for the whopping total of $80 (including tip). 

That's.... pretty crazy for two paltry chicken dishes and mixed vegetables. Great food at exorbitant prices.

Delicious food - very authentic indian cuisine!
The servers are very friendly : )
The view of the air runways is very interesting too.

OK first of all let me start by saying this has to be the best service I have ever received our server was Prashant shah, of course the manager /owner Rajah . Were amazing . The food was exquisite . It was on time . Prashant was very attentive and had great suggestions on what to order for our first time eating Indian cuisine.  We had 4 different types of entr√©es rice of course garlic Nan and 2 Taj Mahal beers along 2 mangos yogurt type drinks.  The price point was great . The view was amazing. Next time definitely wanna try they hookah lounge that is right next to them. Love love love ....thank you guys see you soon

Great Buffet! They have a wide selection for an Indian Buffet. The sauces are very good and not watery like other buffets I have been to. Service was great and the place has a great view of the city and airplanes flying in and out.

Best Indian food 
Delicious food, more quantity, less price and full of flavors 
Totally recommend..!!!

This has been a favorite of ours for a while now.  It seems that every time we go they have something new that we've never tried.  Their garlic naan rocks, try it.  Lastly, it's located on the 2nd floor with a view of the airport so it's a extra nice being able to watch the planes come and go.

Food didn't taste right and the waiter was so rude about everything. I came for dinner before and that was amazing but the buffet wasn't good. Not sure what happened. I would definitely come back for dinner, but after the very rude experience with the waiter, I won't be coming back.

Decided to go give a local business some support as I yearn for a curry every once in a while. We don't eat out that much. We did a groupon. Found the place fairly easily but when you get there, there are a couple of businesses on the lower floor. The entrance is on the side of the building and you have to go upstairs so a little odd. The decor is kind upbeat almost night-clubby feel. Definitely not the  traditional Indian curry house set up. Still the spices wafting through the air made us hungry and it wasn't long before our order hit the table. The place was not busy at all.

The waiter was friendly and attentive. The view was great as you could watch planes coming in to land at the airport. The meal was good although on the smaller portion side. We enjoyed it all overall and will go back for another shot unless we decide to try somewhere else. Got to spread the love!

Sorry this place blows...everything tasted the same, had way to much mint or some funky herb that was an over kill on the taste buds. Curries tasted like they opened a can of Campbell's tomato soup for the base. 

I was looking forward to eating here cuz love Indian food. The one star is for the view of airplanes landing & taking off & the bathroom was super clean, but then again we were the only people eating here...maybe that was a sign to stay far away. 

I will continue to give my money to Mint Indian Bistro for now.
Came here for my birthday last night. The food and service was incredible... tastes like new york!

We went to Pure Indian Cuisine for the lunch buffet. The food was extremely disappointing. Most of the food items tasted very stale. The only good dish was the Kheer. I am not sure if the ala carte orders are better but would not recommend the lunch buffet. The place was however clean and yes the view of the airport is great.

Love this place!! We've been searching for the best Chicken Tikka Masala in Vegas and we finally found it. It happens to be their signature dish too. We went there for our anniversary and my birthday dinner and they gave us a complimentary Mango Lassi which was delicious. Best of all, our kids enjoyed the view of the airport and had a great time watching the planes land/take off. Very friendly staff too!
We had a lovely time! The food and the view were both delicious. And the waiter Carlos was a fun guy... we will be sure to come back here again!
This restaurant has wonderful food, service and ambiance. The view is great too. Enoyed the lunch buffet with family.

Having lived in India, this is the closest to authentic cuisine you can get, particularly here in Vegas.   The Chicken Tikka Mandala is excellent and the Naan is always hot.   The buffet is a great deal!

Worst food I ever ate so far in Vegas. All the vegetarian dishes sucks. Sambar (Yesterday's I believe) is sour, mango custard  is awful (Yesterday's I believe) there's water on top of it and it tasted sour. Mushroom curry was a big disaster. You eat and you feel like sour. Rice is dry AF. I have decided never to visit again. The one star I gave is coz of the Runway view. Just avoid if you can.

Nice view of the strip. Samosas were cold inside. Probably didn't microwave them long enough.  Rice, naan and butter chicken were decent.  Extremely long wait time to get food.  Wait staff was very nice and apologetic about the wait time.  Oh, one more thing.  The music videos they play need to be expanded.  Seemed like the same three songs played over and over.

I've eaten here a couple of times.

The first time I visited was late night when this was about the only Indian restaurant open other than food courts on the strip.

It was a good experience . You get to see flights land at the airport across the strip while you eat . 

I ordered the chicken vindaloo and lassi which was well prepared. I didn't realize that  the curry actually comes with complimentary rice and hence ended up ordering more naan's than necessary.

Over the week, I visited during the lunch hour as well and tried the buffet . The variety was great with a choice of north and South Indian food items. 

It definitely seemed to be busy with teams from a number of offices seeming to come in for the lunch buffet.

5 stars- My husband and I come here at least 2x a month and are addicted! We have never had a bad experience at this place. The food is amazing, service is great and location is ideal. Love this place!
Yes i agree  very Delicious and authentic, and also  Great view of Las Vegas strip.

This was my second time coming and I honestly won't go to any other Indian place regularly. This food is so good and prefect for a quick fix! Loved it the first time, and love it again. Will keep coming here! While here, try their paneer pakora and fish pakora for appetizer. The paneer tikka Masala and butter chicken are awesome!!

Tried to go at 11:10pm and although there were people eating, they claimed they were closed and were not accommodating. That is 50 minutes before they are supposed to close. Waste of time. Lost my business forever.

This place is TOP NOTCH. Since the super bowl was going on they had it playing on all the tv's so which made the meal even better. Very high quality food and environment. Very clean and organized staff. Everything was very good especially the view; you get to see planes land and take off as well as the entire strip. I had the Chilli Chicken and Lasoni Gobi, both were spectacular in spices. Their bar is huge, with all types of alcohol anyone could ask for. I would definitely come back.
Amazing food!  Truly authentic!  Customer service is amazing! Mani is the best manager! He knows how to service customers.

What's not to love about this place! It's over looking the runway so if you get here after 7pm you can watch the planes take off at night. While drinking. Lots. 

The food is damn good and is one of the few Indian places where if you ask for "top hot" you get face melting, booty burning goodness! 

The vindaloo is so freaking good, and you need to sop it all up with the bestest garlic naan ever!

I have a few Indian friends that swear by this place as being the best I town. I agree! 

Try this place, you won't regret it! Oh and ask for Manny for your server. He is the Indian Arnold Schwarzenegger.

so I came back here for lunch buffet. on my last visit they told me about buffet. I had saag paneer,butter chic,Masada dosa, goat curry which one are  my most favourites. but they had other dishes too. I am kinda addicting to this place lol. I wonder watt else they have to surprise me next time

I wish I could give lesser stars. I was in Vegas last night and craved for Indian food and trusting my Yelp brethren,  I went ahead to Pure Indian cusine. I cannot stress enough my disappointment .  They asked for spice levels and we ordered our food spicy. The biriyani  was absolutely  bland. The chilly chicken was smothered with tomato ketchup making it terribly tangy. The garlic naan was soft but again had no taste of garlic to it. At last we ordered ras malai, which again was not very savory. I have no idea how they have managed these stars. I sure caught them on a bad night!

Authentic Indian food with Punjabi tadka... u know what I mean. 
Spacious, clean, smelled nice & reasonably priced. Highly recommended and would be here whenever I'm in Vegas. 

Tip - Try Tandoori roti which is much better compared to any naan.

Let me start off by saying that we're Indian and eat Indian food on a regular basis. That being said, the food here is exceptional. The flavors were authentic and reminded me of the street food found in India. We tried both the vegetarian and non vegetarian food. (Malai kofta and chicken curry) We've already come here twice during our stay in Vegas and will definitely come next time we are in Vegas.
What a little gem of a restaurant, with a gorgeous view of the airport and the strip in the back ground. Food was seriously delicious and well worth the price. Friendly and very attentive.

We have found our Indian food spot. I can't count how many times we've been here but we keep coming back. The food is delicious the decor is beautiful and the service impeccable! I tell everyone I know this is the best and take family when they are visiting.
The food was beyond excellent, the service was top of the line! If we could give this place a 10 we would. We will be back, a rare find for sure.

So so...I am here for the first time for buffet
 Everything is top notch. My favorite goat curry butter chicken and something with cheese. And I had one Indian beer too.                                                       

All in all I loved this place. Beautiful view staff
 Can wait to get back

We discovered this restaurant through Groupon, and we are thrilled.  We haven't been particularly impressed with the Indian cuisine restaurants that we have tried around the valley, and we are not connoisseurs.  There was one that we enjoyed, but it closed a couple of years ago.  We have found out new "go to" spot for Indian cuisine.  The food is excellent and the restaurant is very nice, particularly if you like a view of the Strip or watching planes land.
Good quality food at a reasonable price. Great view of the strip from a distance and you can watch planes take off and land the live music was a nice touch. Will definitely come again.

I'm an extremely picky eater, always have been, always will be. Doesn't mean I won't try a new spot out though, I'm always looking for that hidden gem! Well, to say the least, this spot won't let you down if you are craving - 

A) Authentic Indian Food
B) Phenomenal Service 
C) Unbelievable Views

Situated in a nice little shopping center on the 2nd floor, Pure looks right out at the airport as well as the strip, leaving you with an unobstructed view of Las Vegas as well as the ability to watch planes land and take off, quite fantastic to be honest. 

The food, well the food was awesome. The chicken curry, definitely hit the spot and the spices left my mouth tingling in every right way! 

As awesome as the food was, what really took an already fantastic Indian spot to a whole new level even for Vegas terms, was the service! Mani! This guy is determined to to make sure this restaurant remains successful. He recommended what to get, we got it, and HE DID NOT LET US DOWN! Genuinely a good man, we were able to talk about anything and everything with him and he made sure every step of the way we were 110% satisfied, no matter the request. 

We took out a long time employee from Mexico, who thought he knew spices like no other, but he had never tried Indian. The goal of outspicing Jesse... Accomplished!!

Thanks so much Mani as well as the other gentlemen of Pure Indian!

Great Food and awesome view of the Las Vegas Strip. The Chicken Tikka Masala is a must try!

The prices are great and are all dishes are shareable size  portions. You will not leave hungry!

Knowledgeable, entertaining, and friendly service. The shrimp curry and garlic nan break was delicious, and drink and food prices were very reasonable. The view of McCarren and the strip were picture perfect. I will return...

This place is awesome for watching planes and relaxing after a long day. Came here tonight with my husband and we had some apps, I orders the chicken korma at a medium heat, there was no spice level to it. My husband had shrimp balti at a level hot... Again not spice what so ever tasted like shrimp in marinara sauce. The lamb naan was spot on! Service was fine, waitress was very sweet. Just wish that everything was a lot spicier.
You must try this restaurant!! You will not be disappointed! The food is always delicious, the service is excellent and you get a wonderful view of McCarran's runways. Who could ask for more?!

Great food, great service and excellent views! 
Mani provided us with excellent service and we enjoyed the view of the strip, watching the sunset and the airplanes land! The food was amazing! We ordered the cheese naan, Chicken Korhma and the Lamb Saag! I Highly recommend this restaurant especially around sunset!

The food here is sooooo tasty.  We love coming here to eat when we are in Las Vegas.  On some nights they have live music but I can't remember which nights. They also have good service.  One restaurant we will keep coming back to.  YUM.
Excellent food and service!  I would highly recommend going to this restaurant!  Mani was very attentive to our needs .  Best Indian that I have had lately!  A definite 5 stars.
I have been there a couple of times and each time I have been there the food is superb. So delicious. I will definitely recommend this place.

Wow... I don't even LIKE indian food.  I brought my husband b/c he loves it.  It was absolutely amazing.  We'll definitely be going back.  I love the atmosphere of this place and the view of the strip.  Prices are good.  What a find!!

Delicious! Went there for lunch today and I am one happy camper! There were all my favorite Indian dishes today.  The chef managed to make the dishes flavorful with a hint of heat without being overpowering. Bravo! I also took a coworker who had never had Indian food before and he loved it! A buffet was a large variety of vegetarian and meat dishes. I tried the channa masala, cabbage, spinach (saag paneer), aloo mattar( potato and pea curry), raita, samosas, tandoori chicken, and finally butter chicken, and they were all delicious ! Try it! You won't regret it!

Chicken Vindaloo medium.. Wow so delicious & had the perfect spice (sweating here). My husband had Lamb Rogan Josh mild.. Wow

I would come back here for the buffet so I can try everything 

Excellent wait staff & great entertainment too. What else can you ask for.
This is a must try place in Vegas.  Best malai kofta I had in awhile.  Naan was perfectly cooked which I had with malai kofta. Will def Coke again on my next trip to Vegas.

First, I have trouble giving anything a perfect score.  Hence, four stars instead of five.  Very good Indian food, and excellent service.  But what really sets this Indian restaurant apart from other really good Las Vegas Indian restaurants is the view.  It's on the second floor and  looks out over the airport.  This gives a great view of the entire Las Vegas strip.  We went when the sun just setting.  Can't wait to go back after sundown.  And, again, the food was great.

So what was going to be a 1 star review ends up a 5. I called at 1:45am asking if they're open (hours posted say 3am) and they said kitchen closes at 2:30 which is fine I said we will be there shortly. Arrived 2:05 sat down and waiter said kitchen might be closed and I said I was the one that called and he said it's up to the chef. He said they might only be able to do takeout and I said "No" and he came back and said it's all good and we ordered. (He was very polite and friendly during this whole ordeal). We ordered right away we were starving, and food came out 15-20 min later. I was worried they were just going to microwave the food to get us out as fast as possible but nope! Everything made fresh you could tell. The cheese naan is absolutely the best naan I've ever had AMAZING! The eggplant n peas veggie dish off the top flavorful! The butter chicken, tikki masala chicken and shrimp vindaloo were all great and the rice was perfect. Awesome Indian food our favorite so far in town (I have to say we've had better tikki masala chicken other places but theirs is really good too) We will be back!!!!! Cool airport view also I should mention.

We bought the chicken tikka,lamb roganjosh,mutter paneer and my gosh,everything was lip smacking and it was a great place for dine in plus the view it adds onto the food so I would give this place a 5 star rating for their wonderful service,excellent food and mind blowing ambience the wait staff are just on their toes for their delivery in service from the moment you enter leaving you with a smile on your face until you get back home.Thanks to Mani and Rohan for being there for the assistance with their best selling entrees and appetizers.
Thank you Pure Indian Cuisine for this amazing experience!
We will surely be returning back and recommend it to everyone wanting to try classy food! 
Thank you.

The food was luke warm not hot as freshly prepared food should taste. I'm having a fierce stomach cramp that wasn't there before. Not a great experience if I'm being honest. Nice view from the restaurant though.

Wow, what an authentic Indian Food experience. Mani and Natalia provided amazing service and went above and beyond when we made a mistake ordering. There was live music that set a really great mood as well. Highly recommended!
This place is AWESOME! We love us some Indian buffet but this place comes with a view too! We will definitely be back for some samosas. Btw Nikita is great, too

Beware! I've eaten here twice. The first time (a few weeks ago), the food was above average and the service was ok. Prices were a little high, but the food was good enough that I didnt mind. This time my friend and I both got really sick after. Having not eaten anything else, I know for a fact that it made us sick. On top of that we had ordered enough to have leftovers so now I have to throw away 2/3 of a meal that cost $70+. They also kind of ignored us when we came in, in favor of talking to people that seemed to be personal friends.

A+! I thoroughly enjoyed this buffet! The flavors were bright and every once and a while I bit into some kind of fresh herb (clove, mint etc.) which really made me feel like I was eating fresh food. The naan bread was also delicious, so light and buttery. Every dish that I tried sincerely hit it out of the park. My grandmother tasted the tandoori chicken and she said that it was just as moist and delicious as it looked. It's a little hard to find but the view of McCarran runway is beautiful! Pure is 10X better than the buffet I usually go to and even though it's a nearly 40 min. Drive from my house I'll make it a point to frequent here more often, especially when I'm in the area!

The food was good. The service very average. We Asked for 2 beers and got two huge one (2 bottles in each). They should have informed us of the size. 
The decor was very cafeteria like. Not sure I would go again.

Really amazing staff, very sweet, friendly, and helpful. They unlike some places in town did not mind us walking in at 2:40pm 20mins before their buffet was closing to eat. Some places in town will straight out tell you that they don't let you sit after a certain time. 

Delicious food, amazing services, reasonably priced and on top of it all one of the best backdrops of Vegas. You can watch planes land and have the view of the mountains and the strip! What more could ya ask for. 


Oh yeah, I know! Hope they decide to sell fixed dinner on New Year's Eve so everyone who dines there can watch the fireworks from their dinner table!

Found a gem of a place right next to the airport with a view of the planes taking off. Apart from the location, the buffet was awesome.The mini samosas and the pakodas should be tried with the mint chutney. The butter chicken and the goat curry were good, the chicken biryani was well cooked and I liked the flavour. They give both plain naan and garlic naan (with no extra charge). I was so much full with the Non vegetarian items that I could not try the vegetarian food. My friend loved the vegetarian dishes though. Overall I loved the food here and the five star is for both the food and the view.

Five stars for the food and two, at best, for the service. I do not want to have to flag down the wait staff from talking in a corner because our food was getting cold from not having silverware. 

The food was amazing though. We had the garlic naan, Chicken Korma, and Lamb Rohan Josh.
Awesome spot great view love the accents in here very authentic I felt comfortable and had 2 beers with my food it was a great buzz love the garlic naan will come again

Amazing authentic indian food and service!!!!  A must for the ones who understand the heart of indian cuisine over looking the Las international airport and strip. If you like it spicy, fresh, and steaming hot come over and see for yourself..  PS they have Buffet every day from noon till 3.. Doing that next!

Good decent Indian food at standard prices.
Friendly service.

My date and I split the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Malai Kofta.
Both were exactly what we expected, though low on the spice scale - even though we asked for a 4 out of 5.

The Nan was really fresh and hot. So often if feels like it's been sitting under a heat lamp. Here it felt like it was right off the tandoor. 

Not crazy about the overhead lighting - even though they've gelled it in pretty colors, it still feels harsh. 

However, the view is pretty awesome. We watched a storm roll in over the strip, and that was worth the price of the evening. 

I will definitely be back.
I went here on a date and it was really good. Affordable, tasty, and many vegetarian options.

I came here recently with a group for a birthday luncheon. The buffet is a steal at $10 per person. It includes various types of curries, salads, meat dishes, and rice. I would highly recommend trying the garlic na'an or the butter chicken. That being said, my stomach didn't agree with the food, and other members of my group expressed a similar sentiment. The customer service, however was great, which is why I give this restaurant 3 stars.

Very close to Vegas Airport, awesome Punjabi food. I tried buffet as well as All carte and was glad I found this place. Best part is its open till late 2 am which I think every restaurant should do in city like Vegas. Just loved it..
Great Indian lunch buffet unassumingly tucked into a business complex. The food was delicious and the staff was very kind and attentive.
This is probably one of the best Indian food and they have great customer service! I highly recommend to try this Indian food!

I came to eat here on my birthday and I was so happy that I did. Thanks to yelp I was able to find it because It's sort of hidden . Outside near the parking lot is the entrance to a Mediterranean restaurant, but next to that on the side of the building is an entrance with the restaurant name on the window. It's located upstairs next to a hookah lounge

The restaurant is clean and modern. It also has a view of the outskirts of the strip and the airport which was nice. 

The food was very tasty. They have a variety of Naan to choose from and my family and I became obsessed with the cheese naan. We also ordered butter chicken, chicken tikka masala, matar paneer, and a lamb dish (I forget the name). Everything was excellent and full of flavor. 


Best birthday dinner!

My fiance and I went here with a Groupon I purchased. We ordered appetizers, lamb naan, punjabi chicken curry, and lamb with basmati. The food was absolutely delicious! Fresh, hot, and we thought the serving sizes were generous. We left with a very big doggie bag. :-) I left off one star for the service. It was quick and our waitress was very friendly; but she was new and couldn't answer any of our questions. When you don't know anything about Indian food, that's a little frustrating. I'm sure she just needs a little more practice. :-)  Overall, we had an amazing time and will definitely be coming back. The owner (I think he was the owner) was very friendly and welcoming. I can recommend!
The food here is excellent but customer service is bad, the manager of the restaurant doesn't behave nicely, I will give 3 stars for food.

Oh so delicious! Rich, complex, subtle, colorful Indian flavors. YUMMM.

And such wonderful, cheerful, gracious service from Nikita. Everything she recommended was spot on great.

The one criticism I have is that it's a little hard to locate, being on the second floor, next to a hookah lounge, and the signage could be much clearer.

But once we arrived it was wonderful all the way.

The menu is a little overwhelming with so many delicious choices. [Nice problem to have!] I literally could eat here 3 times a week for 6 months and never have the same thing. 

I ended up getting the spinach paneer and a lamb curry. Wifey, a picky  vegetarian, got something just as delicious. And she was able to enjoy the paneer, too. I'm carnivorrific, but I could eat Indian  vegetarian forever and be happy.

And THE VIEW! It's really cool being across from the airport on the second floor. I couldn't stop watching the big ol' jet airliners landing and taking off.

Even the ToGo containers are the best, those little Tupperware bins that won't leak on the way home and can be used again and again.

Go to this place!!!! It's great!

Excellent food and service.  Especially from Server Mani. The butter chicken and Palek paneer is as good as I've had anywhere.  Sunday champagne brunch / buffet was perfect! Also very reasonably priced. Added bonus is it's right next to the airport so you can have a yummy meal before you catch your flight. .  I'll be back

Excellent location with awesome Indian food. We have been dining at India palace for over 15 years and Pure Indian Cuisine is their newest addition. Indian food at its finest with Las Vegas strip views. Mani was our server and he takes great care of us. Highly recommend this place
Was looking for a decent Indian restaurant in Vegas and this restaurant did not disappoint me at all. Amazing food and not to miss the entr√©es! Feels home-like.

One of the worst Indian restraints I've been to. 

We ordered off the menu and did not eat the buffet in hopes of fresher food. 

The garlic naan was burnt. The center had been rolled out to thin and was charred to a crisp. No garlic flavor. 

The chicken dish we ordered was wrong and had to be sent back. The redo was just as bad. 

The vegetable curry was mostly  frozen vegetables tossed in with some fresh bell peppers and onions in a nondescript yellow sauce they called curry.  

The basmati rice was over cooked and dry. Normally you get light fluffy long fragrant grains.  We got the opposite. Small broken grains of poor quality overlooked dry rice. 

Service was poor. There is no organization. We had three different people trying to take out order which would sound like s good thing. But when you ask one person a question or dietary requests and someone else takes your order it leads to mistakes. 

Location: was this an office space before? There is no real entrance to this restaurant. Just a series of hallways and if you figure out the maze you get rewarded with poor quality food.
This place is delicious with very sweet wait staff. The view of the runways at night is amazing.

I dropped by for dinner with my family.  My family is somewhat unfamiliar with Indian cuisine so I ended up ordering a couple of my favorites and some of the classics for them to try.

I ordered the chicken tikka masala, lamb rogan josh, dal tadka, and malal kofta along with a side of garlic naan.  Their dal tadka and malal kofta were really good and reminded me a lot of my favorite Indian restaurant in New York.  My family enjoyed all the dishes too and it was a great experience for them.  Our server Nikita was wonderful and was all smiles for us.  This place has only been open for a couple months and it's far off the strip but it's a gem and well worth a visit.

Worst Indian food. I will never go or suggest anyone.  It's not even eligible for one star but yelp mandates it. 

1. Food was cold and didn't look or taste fresh. Not sure when they prepared 

2. They gave rice and we saw hair in the rice 

3. When I told them food was bad, manager didn't even apologized  and he charged full bill. 

Worst food and worst customer service.
This is absolutely the best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. The food and service is great, and the view is spectacular!! A must visit.

Other reviews were right the food was very good, but the service was not up to par!   My server was the bus girl, she could not answer question about which dish was what! 
It was not that busy for a bus person to wait on us!  The service was very slow we came in before a party of 8 and were served 15 mins after they were served.
Very nice restaurant as well, and it being on the second story gives decent views of the airport and the skyline.

The lunch buffet was amazing.  We showed up at 11:00 and had the place to ourselves.  The food was hot, fresh, and the service was impeccable.  Though a very nice selection, I think I tried almost everything on the buffet.   The goat and butter chicken were my favorites.  The restaurant was on the second floor, which was a little hard to find, but had a great view of the airport.  Having never been there or have looked at a menu, I was extremely impressed how reasonable this place was considering the experience I had.  I would highly recommend them.  My only concern was how few of people were there at a prime lunch time.

In town for a work conference, and after a string of disappointing hotel buffets and sandwiches that looked far better than they tasted, I found this gem of an Indian restaurant. The veggie simosas and lamb curry had me tearing up a tiny bit (spicy), but it was extremely tasty. One of the best I've had. Very friendly and prompt service. Highly recommend this place.
The service is abysmal, they forgot half of our food. Luckily I noticed before I got into my car. I'm still giving it three stars because the quality of the food is amazing.
Great place the food is awesome and the prices unbeatable i was really happily surprised try the chicken tandori and the lamb tika masala with some cheese naan

Sorry to rate this restaurant 1 star. I didnt like the food at all. In all chat they put chole. No chutneys with chaat and it didnt tasted good at all. Customer service was zero. I felt the servers were little rude. A short guy with lot of muscle was too rude. Never going to come back.

Awesome service!! Even better food and a great view too. It's so chill in this hidden place that it's a nice place to escape to anytime of the day. Everything was delicious and Prashant our server was the best!! Definitely will be back soon : )
Excellent authentic Indian. Friendly staff, amazing view, comfortable seating, great atmosphere...this is a must for fans of amazing Indian food!

Every once in a while I have a hankering for Indian food.  My usual place is out of the way with horrendous parking.  Pure Indian Cuisine is easy to locate with plenty of parking.  It may seem strange when walking into the entrance but just go up to the second level and follow the signs.  A long little hallway leads you back to the dining room and bar.  Windows span the restaurant which gives you a great view of the planes landing. The view is outstanding!  Of course I am a bit biased if you know what my husband does for a living. 

We came here for their lunch buffet.  With Indian food I always enjoy a variety on my plate.  Their buffet has good offerings from soups, salad, vegetarian and traditional.  Unfortunately I am really bad about the names of their dishes but the intense flavors of each selection really hit every taste bud.  Of course they bring out a basket garlic naan bread which was inhaled immediately.  

The service here was welcoming and very attentive.  With good service and good food, there wouldn't be a hesitation to come back.

Excellent lunch buffet. Service was amazing fast and polite. Food was some of the best indian buffet I've ever had, there was a wide selection, and kept fresh and hot. Setting was nice, 2nd floor view in a very clean maintained.
This place is the bomb! Best butter chicken I have had. Food was great, service was great, and a view of the airport at night was cool.  Food was fast so if time is tight for a flight no worries.

Awesome place to be. Love coming here for the food,view and hookah. Everyone is so friendly and nice always welcoming. Have never been dissaponted. Must try my favorite the butter chicken with nan, to die for. My number one place recomend it to anyone .
The food is good for the most part. My only complaint is that they take too long to bring the nan bread by the time you are done with the first plate the bread comes.

Best Indian Food in Town!!! 

Whether you're a local or visiting from out of town and craving Indian food, Pure Indian is the place to go.  We usually go to their lunch buffets.  You get to try a variety of items and the views are pretty spectacular too.  You see the strip and the airport right outside the window.  I can't even tell you what is the best item to try because they are all amazing.  My favorites are Saag paneer, Daal, and aloo gobi.  My husband loves the butter chicken.  They bring out hot fresh naan that is delicious and soft.  I have yet to be disappointed.  I would also like to say if you're ever in need to throw a party, celebration dinner etc.  Manny (manager) will help you out! He was our man.  He helped us get together a menu, organize and execute an awesome party for our 4 year old.  Their staff was on point and very helpful.  Thank you Manny and Pure Indian staff for always exceeding our expectations!
Really nice buffet with complimentary drinks and a good choice of options.all food tasted good.service was also good.ambience was nice and location was also good.

Delicious for dinner buffet was not great I have been here numerous times but only twice for lunch buffet and I don't think I will give it a third.  We showed up at 12, in my opinion what should be height of lunch, and expected the freshest hottest food, sadly we were disappointed. The food was good amazingly flavorful and everything, but it was not hot, not cold either just warm. The tandoori chicken was dry as though it was reheated from the day before. I also didn't care for the lamb. Being that I'm not completely familiar with all Indian food I rely on the labels. There were some, but not enough and asking the staff didn't help because the person I got was less then capable of communicating clearly. 
All that being said I have gone for dinner and had hot delicious amazing food. The chili chicken is wonderful. As well as paneer tiki masala and samosa chaat, vegetable pakor. I didn't care for their bhurtha bharta but it wasn't bad.  have so many things I still want to try!!

I don't normally like Indian food but this place tastes awesome! The interior of this place had really nice metallic colored wooden floors and the views are a 360 view of the strip as well as the airport.

This is the perfect place to have brunch in the afternoon and a lounge drink at night. The owner, Raj has such great hospitality and they also have live music that was relaxing to my ears. 

The Indian spice level for the buffet is perfect but the dessert "gulab jamun" was too sweet for my taste. It's a fried dough ball sugared with sugar syrup! 

I would love to come back again.

So, my first time here was so bad that me and my date got past the mad stage and just started to laugh. I must have ordered 4 things off the menu and they kept coming back and saying they were out, with 10 to 20 minute breaks inbetween each time. So, after waiting all this time and being out of everything we finally left without having dinner. For this adventure we sat in the Hookah Lounge portion. Thier hookah was terrible as well. Super harsh.

After dropping one of thier managers off while driving for Uber, she talked me into trying them again. The second time my date and I sat in the restaurant section (same waiter as first time). This time amazing service and delic
ous food. Thier Naan is my only complaint, tough and boring. One of the best Aloo Gobi I have ever had. 

If I had to rate this place on first experience it would be a 1. If I based it on the second experience 4 to a 5 (I love Naan so it disappoints me)
So average rating 3. We will see the next time if I adventure into there.

Good food..That's great it's open till 3am..Good view of airport from the resturant.
Prakash was very sweet and served us very well.
Loved the Chai..They specially made it with extra ginger.
Food was very good and service was simply awesome! Server was very accommodating and anticipated our needs! This was a very wholesome experience! The buttered chicken was so good!

Worst food in las Vegas. Found insect in the food, when asked shown rude behavior. They serve the previous day and old food for buffet. Ala carte is served from buffet items. Please avoid and save your bucks..

I went here for lunch today and all I gotta say if that it was bomb!!!  So why the 4 stars? I minused one because the ladies bathroom was in very sad shape. There were 3 stalls and all three were filthy and no toilet paper....:(

Now onto the nitty gritty....:)

Ambiance was very nice. The restaurant was clean and the tables were set up nicely and the view of the planes taking off and landing was great. The only drawback is the location. The entrance for the restaurant is on the side of the building and the restaurant is upstairs.  There really are no signs pointing to where the restaurant is located. So as soon as u enter.... U see a small lobby with stairs to your left right next to an elevator. But no signs as to if the restaurant is upstairs. Go upstairs!! :). When u go upstairs u will see some red signs saying restaurant and lounge and for the life of me I can't remember the third sign....:( follow the hallway under the red restaurant sign and u will start to smell the deliciousness!!! Follow your nose!! :) (4/5) 

Service was impeccable! There was only one large table of 6 ppl when I entered. I was told that I could sit wherever I wanted so I chose a booth and I was served with water and iced tea and mango lassi which were the drinks that I ordered. :) the ice tea and water were your run of the mill.... But mango lassi was delicious! Perfectly creamy with just a hint of the yogurt and just perfect for putting out some of the heat from the dishes. My water glass/tea were constantly filled and they came and touched my table constantly to make sure I was good. (5/5)

Food.... They had a great selection of sauces.... I'm normally not big onto the sauces but I saw a green sauce that reminded me of this salsa Verde I had back home in Texas... Of course it did not taste like what I remembered but the green sauce was delicious nonetheless! It had chilis, mint and cumin I think.... All I can say was that I just wanted to eat it up... So good with the vegetable samosas....I just didn't want to stop. Lol. I skipped some dishes like the rice and the French fries. Why load up on carbs when there were so many other flavorful carbs like naan coming your way.... Puhahaha

The saag paneer was done right. So flavorful and so balanced. It was delicious!!! The chicken tandoori I did not touch as there was a customer there before that kept on going back to the buffet line with a half full dish and that's what he was grabbing and it looked like he had touched the tongs to his plate of half full food.... I couldn't be sure but I wasn't going to touch it. I wished the staff working there would have said something about using a new plate every time. I guess I figured that everyone knew not to bring an old plate but just to grab a new one??? I'm guessing not. :/ I digress.... Back onto the food...

They had salad which I skipped... For obvious reasons as there were more flavorful things waiting for me. :) there was another curry dish with chickpeas in it... Forgot the name but it was good as well. The chilli chicken was very tender and full bodied and delicious. The butter chicken like the name implies was like "butta"... Very very tender almost melt in your mouth deliciousness!!

But my all time favorite dish was the coconut potato and to think that I almost passed this one by. The coconut flavor balanced out the curry flavor... It was so creamy and yummy!!

Overall my impression was that they are trying very hard to please and the good speaks for itself. The chef came out of the kitchen to check on the food a couple of times as I was eating there...I appreciate that. :)

Will I be back? Heck yeah!!! :) I can't wait to come back and try the dinner.

Honestly I don't understand all the glowing reviews. It's an Indian restaurant  in the airport district with an unappealing second floor entry, sitting alongside hookah up bars and low end restaurants. That was a warning sign but I thought Vegas reviewers know their secret places. Not the case. 

As far as the food goes, you could do much better in a run-of-the-mill Indian buffet restaurant than this place. I was there for dinner, and prices for basic vegetarian entr√©es run well over what I would pay in high-end places in DC metro area.  The samosa chickpeas had cheap oil fried samosas and canned chickpeas with powdered spice.  The naan disappointed with its low end flour.  The potato cumin had burnt cumin seeds taste. The dal makhani had honestly been cooked for half a day it seemed.  Maybe this is appealing to first timers and folks not too familiar with Indian food.  But anyone who has tried mainstream Indian or cooks at home and understands fresh, whole spice taste of any cuisine would know better. 

The waiter was a good natured guy. I wouldn't ding the service. Nothing out of the ordinary. 

The lighting was off with a stark tube light shining above and two endless looped Indian entertainment of second rate Bollywood.  But even novices know decent ambiance. This place disappointed. 

I'll venture out to say many of the reviews may be gamed.  It was a sad start to a spring break in NV/AZ.

We were in desperate need of food at 10:30 pm and all the restaurants in the casinos on the strip closed at 10 pm so we went for plan B and were not disappointed.  It seems out of the way but it's really not and get an amazing night view of the strip. 

We ordered the samosa chaat,lamb rogan josh, palak paneer, shrimp biryani and onion and garlic naan.  It was all amazing and exactly what we needed.  The staff was attentive and friendly and the service was fast.

Amazing food and atmosphere . Great service and just killer food. Samosas, garlic Naan, chicken tikka masala , mango llasi! I was in heaven . It's weird placement of the restaurant , you take the stairs or elevator up to second floor and you are here. I would come back in a hot second !

Extremely slow service. We waited for an hour and half and all we got in that time was appetizers. That's when there were like only 5 other guests. 

I'm not sure why they have high ratings. Must be a scam

Excellent food.
Reasonably priced.
Wonderful courteous service.
Comfortable ambience. Excellent view.
Very highly recommended !!!!

Awesome view of the air planes and the best Indian food in all of Las Vegas! Thank you sooo much for a great time and warm meal! The service was fantastic too! I was very impressed that the spicy level 7 was actually perfectly spiced for my meal-

This place is great! The service is good the staff is friendly and the food is delicious!
Pure India cuisine has live music and is a very quiet nice place to have lunch!
The lunch price is average for most other indian food resturants around lunch.
It's definitely worth the visit and they also deliver with bitesquad.

HOWEVER,
It can be a little bit confusing to find, it's a small door next to the Mediterranean kabob place you have to go up stairs and down the hall a little bit you come to a long hallway and it's at the end pass the hookah lounge.

When a restaurant features a view of planes landing, who else do you take but your flight attendant friend? Watching her geek out over the planes was almost as good as the food itself. The restaurant-bar-lounge is somewhat hidden in the second floor of a business park, but well worth seeking out if you enjoy Indian cuisine.

Their menu is expansive, opt for something beyond Butter Chicken and Tandoori dishes- though they likely do those just as well. We shared the Lamb Rogan Josh and Shrimp Saag entrees, with basmati rice and garlic naan. Dishes were amply portioned with flavorful sauces and a nice heat, and the proteins were fresh and juicy. If you enjoy the kick, upgrade to spicy!  

The service for dinner seemed overwhelmed even before they got busy, with items forgotten, check errors, and a delay receiving our food. That said, I would come back for their lunch buffet ($12/pp?) to try more of their dishes before returning for a dinner. Good date night spot for the food quality and views!

Wow.  This is such a hidden gem.  On the way back from the airport, we see an Indian restaurant and hookah bar.  We stop into the building with an excellent view of the planes landing and taking off.  We had saag paneer, lamb saag, chicken kimerh and lamb naan.  Hands down the best Indian food we've ever eaten and we're all veterans of punjabi and the depth and balance of spice and heat was superb.  The rice was fragrant and was a perfect foil for the sauces.   We started with pakora and samosas and weren't disappointed at all.  We rounded it off with the BEST kheer I've ever eaten.  Definitely worth visiting again!

Chicken Tikka is awesome, just ordered second plate of goat curry!! Scenic view of the strip and airport, a very exclusive feeling. This place is a hidden gem in Vegas. Above all else the food is truly delicious!!!!
Food was good. There wasn't much exciting about it. I'm used to eating Indian food with lots of flavor with a party in my mouth but this felt more like a slow dance. Was good but not great.

I absolutely loved the food here! My girlfriend and I had the lamb Naan and chicken Tikka masala. The food was amazing and the service was great!  Our server, Mani was so nice and accodating! I'll definitely recommend it in the future.

Excellent food! I had the Chicken Korma and it was delicious! Best Indian restaurant that I've ate at in a long time. Service was great. The restaurant sits across from the airport with a view of the Las Vegas strip.

This is probably one of the worst Indian buffets that I have visited.  The selection of dishes was small.  The Tandoor chicken was dry.  The vegetable dishes were quite oily.  The goat curry was pretty much bones, cartilage or fat.  The dishes that were available were hardly replenished.  I am unsure why this place gets great reviews.  On top of that, they automatically add an 18% gratuity to the bill for mediocre service.

I ordered from this place yesterday through grub hub and I accidentally ordered the same thing twice. I called the restaurant directly to correct it. They advised me to cancel my order and re-order it because the item I wanted to swap for was more expensive. I couldn't figure out how to do it and they were kind enough to just swap the item for me free of charge. Great customer service, great food, so happy with them!

Worst Service 

The service was really horrible, they should just get some new staff. We went in for an evening snack and light dinner. The first person who came to take the order was staring at us as if "why are you guys even here". We were around six folks and since we just ordered snacks and light dinner I suppose the number of items were few and he was not pleased with it. The service just got worser from there, they never came near the table when we needed something and since it was evening the sun was shining right on our faces and the guys didn't care. They just stood far off near the kitchen and it was difficult to get some attention and close the window curtains. 

To top that when we ordered tea they brought cold tea whereas the item was supposed to be hot Indian tea. Again we had to get their attention and the get the tea re heated which took like 10 minutes, one of us just drank the cold tea not bearing to wait to get their attention ( we had order 2 tea and both were cold).

The rest of the food items were good for which I would have given a 4 star but the service was just horrible.

And the really worst part was they added an automatic gratuity of 18% when they deserved none.

I would say that this place combines the three things I enjoy most - amazing service, great food and hookah.  So lets go a bit into more detail on each one:

Amazing service - This place has a great staff that really knows how to take care of their customers.  My friend and I spent quite a bit of time talking with the owner who is an amazing and very interesting guy.  Service is super fast and very attentive.  

Great food - There is a reason why all reviews rant and rave about the food at this place.  The menu has authentic Indian cuisine done to perfection.  I definitely want to stop by here for lunch to try their Lunch Buffet.

Hookah - If you are a hookah person this is among the top three places in the valley.  This is the only one that I know that will serve hookah in a quiet, intimate atmosphere where you can go and enjoy the hookah with friends or on a date and don't have to worry about loud music and a bunch of underage kids.  Also the only place in the valley to serve all glass hookah for the price of what you would usually get a regular hookah for.  

PS.  One thing I have not mentioned is the view.  This is the only place in the valley that has a perfect view of the airport and the strip.  You won't find that ANYWHERE else.

Groupon!! $30 off two people

Live Music
Great Spicy Food
Hookah (if you're into that)
Fantastic View of planes landing and of the Strip at 10pm

I ordered the Lamb Biryani with Garlic Naan and he ordered chicken something that was extremely hot.  He told them he wanted it "Hot" and that was exactly what he got.  I stayed away from it.

The drinks were not great, though.

Everything from the view to the food and the service were all AMAZING! Nikita was our server and she was super attentive, patient and great at explaining what dishes were what and helping us decide what to order. Great experience will definitely come back.
We came here for a buffet. The food was bad. One star was for the service.Avoid this if your expecting good  food . The food doesn't make up the price.worst food in recent times.

The food is authentic from the appetizers to the main entrees.  The customer service was great. Mani our server was fun to talk and laugh with. They had live music by Miko which was enjoyable to listen too. There's a view of the Vegas strip and the planes. I highly recommend this restaurant!!!

This place is phenomenal! It features some of the best curries and paneer dishes I've ever had. It is definitely a notch above your average Indian restaurant!! They have a gorgeous view of the Vegas skyline and big windows to enjoy the views and watch airplanes take off and land. The restaurant is well appointed with classy, modern fixtures. They also have top notch entertainment on the weekends. I was so impressed with this place, I feel fortunate to live nearby.

There are few times in life when food is so perfectly cooked and served. I would give 5 out of 5 for the taste and presentation. Staff is very friendly and quick. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in town and want to taste some quality Indian food.

I went to Vegas over the long weekend and was looking for the Indian restaurants which open late and found this one. When we went there it was a surprise and we found Hookah bar there . There is a cool belly dancer too who is dancing on Bollywood music. It was great fun with hookah, belly dancer and enjoying Indian food.
Four best parts
1) Best food, its fresh and north Indian
2) service is best, all the waiters, manager and hookah waiter are all down to earth and fast in action and to the point.
3) stunning view, you can see Vegas airport from window and see flights landing.
4) Hookah +Belly dancer +Bollywood

I would definitely recommend this place and you will have best time.

Great Indian food. We are a family of five visiting Las Vegas. Our kids like Indian, but are picky. They ate every bite. We kept it simple with chicken curry and chicken tikka masala with naan. We picked this restaurant after reading a lot of reviews on yelp. We very pleased with our choice. Don't gamble on an Indian restaurant on a great trip to Vegas. Take your family here!

This was very authentic Indian food and amazing quality hookah. The service could not get any better , and the atmosphere is the best in town !! Mani was a very great professional server who had extensive menu knowledge

Always incredible food.  I like my food so spicy it melts my face off, and they are pretty good about accommodating me when I ask for it. The staff is friendly and service is great. Lamb vindaloo and garlic chili naan are my go to, and I still haven't had it better anywhere else.  I highly recommend this place!
The type of food these awesome guys make is my favorite! They are magicians! Delicious food and great customer service!

Mani was amazing! I was a little worried because I had to work on a paper for school but I also wanted really good India food. Mani allowed us to order food (and dessert) all night while we worked on our paper. He even offered to give us the Wifi password. I LOVE PURE INDIAN CUISINE!

This is a wonderful Indian restaurant that we had dinner at on our last trip to Las Vegas.  The service was a little slow but the employees were attentive when they were bringing your items to you.  The food was delicious.  I must say as someone that frequently has stomach issues eating unfamiliar food, their food did not do that to me at all so that is a huge plus!  I had something that was curry as I usually in an Indian restaurant. My husband had a smoothie like beverage and said it was very good.   As someone with an avid interest in aviation, being located with an end to end view of the Las Vegas airport's runway was a great treat as I was watching it during the meal. The restaurant is located adjacent to a hookah lounge and parking is limited and we had to go underground into the parking for the building which is similar to an office building.  We plan to return on a future visit so that may be the best sign of it being a good place to check out.

This probably is the worst Indian buffet experience I had may be after India palace in flagstaff but at least they had chicken in chicken curry. Here they had potato. It took them 20 mins to bring naan and they even weren't busy, very slow staff. Go to mint I can here since there was waiting there

Oh man! I missed the lunch buffet but the dinner menu did not disappoint! Easily the best Mixed Vegetable Curry I've had in a very long time - colorful and tender ingredients with a refreshing made-to-order vibe. So good! Palak Paneer was savory and delicious, as was the Dal Tadka. I got every dish 7/10 on the hot (spice) scale. I could've done 5 or 6 and it still would've been sufficiently spicy. Dinner portions are generous, which is nice because you *will* want leftovers.

Looking forward to trying the lunch buffet before/after my next mid-day flight at McCarran.

Mint and Mt. Everest have some serious competition in Pure! For the last couple of years, I've been declaring Mint as the best Indian in the city, now I'm definitely not so sure. Pure could very well be the hands down best in town!

Wow, from the live guitar and the amazing view to the attentive, courteous service and delicious food, this restaurant was perfect from start to finish.  Thank you so much Nikita for helping to make our night so great!

Best food in Las Vegas! I have ate Indian food at many places this restaurant beats all the places. They have Indian food and hooka while you wait for your meal. Mani makes you feel like your at home.

Wow! Was craving Indian food, but nothing worth going to late night in the Summerlin area. Luckily found this place on 4 Square, so decided to try it out. First off, the view from the restaurant is wonderful.  Mani was our server. He chose a cauliflower appetizer for us that was simply amazing.  The lamb Korma was pure heaven. Everything was delicious, service wonderful, definitely recommend for late night (and anytime) Indian dining.
This place is AMAZING! The food is down right THE BEST Indian food I've ever tasted. There's   AWESOME views of the McCarran airport landing strip & the Las Vegas Strip. A+

This was my first time trying Indian food.  I read the Yelp reviews and it helped me to select some dishes.  First they brought out some complimentary crispy crackers with two dips.  We ordered some Dal soup and it was really delicious. The Curry Lamb was excellent and we dipped the Naah into the yummy sauce.  The only dish I was not too crazy about was the Chicken Tikka Masala because the  chicken was dry.  The rice was very tasty.  We really enjoyed the meal and will go back soon!

My fianc√© ordered from this place using door dash so I'll only talk about the food since we weren't at the actual place. 
We got an order of "lamb rogan josh" which contained lamb chunks cooked with yogurt, onions and spices with basmati rice. We had a choice of choosing the spice for our lamb. We chose mild spiciness and it was a good kick. We also originally chose "chicken tikka naan" but the person preparing our food got our order wrong and gave us regular naan instead. So to go off on the lamb rogan josh, it tasted very delicious and fresh despite it being delivered to us from a 20 minute drive away. There was enough sauce from the meat to drench into our rice, making it perfect to dip our naan bread into.  
Overall, the food was great. We would come back to try everything else on the menu.
I did a takeout! Food was ready when we arrived! It was one of the best Indian food we've ever had! We ordered spicy and they were really spicy! We loved it!

I went to Pure Indian Cuisine for dinner last night and had some of the best Indian food I've ever had! The view is amazing, Mani provided great service and the food is to die for. I'll definitely be back! :)

First time here or any Indian restaurant here in Vegas. I'd give this place 4 stars because they're very accommodating. Food is good I enjoyed the butter chicken and naan bread from the lunch buffet. Everything else I tried for a taste and I like it. Not bad for $11.99 lunch buffet.

Really enjoyed the lunch buffet here!  So many choices of curries on it, as well as some really amazing rice pudding.  The garlic naan was brought out fresh, twice, and it was the best I've ever had. Seriously. Only $9.99 for all you can eat!! The atmosphere is clean and modern, with a great view of the strip. Check this place out, ASAP.
Definitely the best Indian food in Las Vegas. Great service amazing view. If your in Vegas do stop by!

Overall an extremely pleasant dining experience. Beautiful view, great atmosphere, and of course, exquisite food! It was my first time having Indian cuisine, and I was not disappointed. Everything was packed with tons of different flavors and had a home cooked quality to it, which I particularly enjoyed. Last, but certainly not least, the service was amazing. I felt welcomed from the moment I walked in, to the moment I left. I will definitely be a return customer.

Excellent food, great customer service, and a view to kill for! 
 Being an East Indian and having grown up on North Indian food, I can vouch for some of the 'cool' menu items like Lasooni Gobi, their veg fritters are really authentic. 

Mani takes special interest in his guests. He is the most experienced of their staff and knows his way around the best dishes. He is focused on impressing his customers which is always good! 

Very amiable and warm customer service! 

A definite 5 star!

The ambiance, view, singer and service were exceptional. The quality, temperature, flavor, toughness of the meat and value of the food was slightly below average but we are from SF where ethnic food is great. We used a promotional offer which made it a good deal. There is a parking garage underneath and you need to use it or some guy outside in the strip mall will make you re-park.

Don't know how I missed this place after so many years here, but really fabulous Indian Cuisine. Authentic, delicious, nice service and fabulous view of strip and the planes landing at McCarren. 

My Fianc√©e has the Tikka Masala, I had the Mix Grill. We shared Samosas as well. We both raves about our food the entire meal. 

It's not super clear as far as its location in building, you want to go to 2nd floor, next to Hookah Lounge.
First time having Indian food, was a great first impression :) The lamb tikka masala was delicious
Wonderful Indian cuisine!  l enjoyed the view of landing and departing flights at McCarran.  Every dish we ordered was very, very tasty and the service was very good.

The short version:

Food - excellent
Service - very good
Pricing - reasonable
Ambiance - quirky, but pleasant
We will be back

The details:

Food:
appy - vegetable samosa - well blended ingredients inside and crispy outside - excellent with the brown sauce on the table
appy - lasoni gobi - tangy, spicy, and cooked perfectly
appy - aloo tikki - the spices in the patties went wonderfully with the chickpeas on the side
bread - garlic naan - fresh garlic on naan, enough said
bread - cheese naan - gooey cheese in naan, my kid loved it
entree - channa masala - spiced perfectly and had a nice texture
entree - butter chicken - tender and buttery
entree - lamb rogan josh - it melted in my mouth
entree - chicken tandoori - the dish was perfectly cooked, which can be a real challenge with tandoori dishes
drink - mango lassi - cool, sweet, and smooth
drink - sweet lassi - it was ok, i preferred the mango
drink - coffee - satisfying
dessert - kheer - my little one ate the whole thing and smiled the whole time

Service:
we were seated quickly, our drinks and dishes arrived quickly, we were offered excellent suggestions for food, and my water glass was never empty.

Pricing:
It was very reasonable for all the food we got. There were 5 of us, we got all the things i listed above, plus a Taj Mahal beer and 2 Sprites, and the total w/tax was just over $120 + tip. Full disclosure, we had a groupon, so we got a few dollars off, but I did not include that in the total for my review. We were all stuffed and 4 of us have plenty of leftovers for lunch tomorrow.

Ambiance:
Like I said, quirky, but pleasant. It's set in with a bunch of office/industrial park kinds of places and it's on the 2nd floor (there is an elevator and ramps outside, so it's accessible). The table settings are semi-formal, seats in the booths are comfy, there are colorful lights set into the ceiling by the bar, the walls are full windows, some facing the airport (you can watch planes take off) and some facing the strip (lots of lights, which is fun), a small spot for live music, multiple TVs on and muted (some on Indian channels, some on the hockey game), and it's attached to a hookah bar (totally separate area, so you don't smell the smoke or even see the hookahs from the restaurant - I walked through, though, and it has a very relaxing vibe with another wall of windows - if I smoked a hookah, I would enjoy that space). The musician that they had playing, Miko, sounded great, was very nice, and played jazzy versions of a wide variety of pop type tunes. He didn't take a break for the whole 2 hours we sat there, so I definitely tipped him, too.

The final judgment:
We will be back. I enjoyed the experience.

Amazing!!! This is the best place so far to have Indian food. The flavor for curry is absolutely delicious. The paneer is so fresh and soft. The staff is very friendly, awesome service. The mango lassi was too good. 
The ambiance  wowww! U see flights taking off and landing every half a minute, unstoppable view of the runway. You can have delicious dinner with fabulous view of STRIP
The food quality is so fresh and the best part is they have hookah lounge beside the restaurant so you can have hookah as well as food.
The best part is they play cricket on big TV and I'm big fan of cricket. Have a big bar you can sit and have beer which is available on tap, watch football if you are a football fan.
I wish i can give more stars to this place! Definitely the best food and highly recommended for your friends. Thank you Pure Indian Cuisine  I'm in love with place. 
Manni ( Mangager) is soo nice and friendly. He gave us complimentary gulab jamun for me and my friends.

Decided on Indian food today for lunch, all five of us got there at 11:40 and had no wait. I perused the menu and opted for the lunch buffet for $11.99. 

They had a wide variety and all the naan bread you can eat :-). I tried the tofu curry, vegetable curry, butter chicken and veggie spring rolls. I also tried some f the sauces with the spring roll. The basmati rice fried rice and white rice was very good. Love to soak up the excess curry with it and dip the garlic naan bread. 

The views from this second story restaurant are amazing as it overlooks the airport runways and excellent views of the strip. Could be a great place for a New Years party as you could see the entire show!

The lunch buffet was delicious and I will be back. After looking over the menu I might come for dinner as well so that I could try the chicken or shrimp vindaloo varieties.
The food is good had the Chicken saag. The restaurant is modern and plain with a great view of the airport and strip. The service was slow and the food took over 30 minutes to get.

Great food and friendly service! We had the butter chicken, chicken tikka, garlic naan, and some yogurt dish.  The butter chicken was the best I've ever had! There's liver entertainment Friday night too.

I will definitely be back!

I LOVE THIS PLACE. This is the first place I tried Indian cuisine and was over the moon about it! I can't believe I went 26 years without these divine flavors in my life. 

My office is just around the corner from here so my coworkers and I often come here for the $11.99 lunch buffet. They put the menu up on their Facebook page so you know what they're serving that day before you show up. 

The view of the airport and strip is gorgeous and they sometimes have live music that's pretty decent! 

Their butter chicken is amazing and garlic naan is to die for! Service is absolutely exceptional every time. Definitely check this place out!

Definitely one of the best Ive ever had! Been over 25 yrs sincr Ive been to the Middle East and this brought me back! Heres the rundown. Naan bread w garlic is done to perfection,  soft hot and the finished edges done jist right! The buffet had a wonderful selection, several vegetarian items. Tandoori chicken had amazing flavor and by far best butter chicken out west. Curry goat was amazing and rice were exceptional. To top it off the runway views are awesome.   We live 120 miles away and when we come back to Vegas we will return!
Great food with good ambience and service. Highly recommend this place if you are visiting or in Vegas and one more good thing, it's open till 3 AM.

Went with some co-workers, 3 Indian, 3 non-Indian (including myself)
Everyone's consensus was that it was very good.
The naan bread was fantastic (both regular and garlic) and the chicken tikka masala & the sagg were the favorites.

We will be back

ps. Since it is new, they don't have much signage out front, so just part at the address specified and go to the second floor.

We came to eat Saturday lunch buffet. $13.99/person

Good :  good place to eat and watch the tarmac where planes were taking off and landing. 
Decor was a mixture between modern and traditional. 

Bad: very limited selections of food for a Saturday brunch. 
All food label in their Indian names, which to me would not help someone who does not know anything about Indian food.  ( am I going to each chick, pig, or moooo.. it's a guessing game or ask them to tell you each and every item there.) 

Ugly: was told previously by calling that they charged children 4-10years old $7.99 price for lunch. 
When paid . They charged my 10 years old adult price. I asked why that was. The waitress stumble a bit then said well up to 10. So I said yes he's not 11 , why am I paying adult pricesfor him??  she then said  she will double check. Came back and now said completely something different, children up to 7 ..  lol 

Whatever, that's not good business , considering I didn't even ordered Champaign with my lunch.

If you like your indian in a stripped down conference room, you have found Mecca. Food OK,service ZERO..Put in order,waiter forgot to put it in. Next came back, was told it did not print. One hour after arriving, got some samosas on the house. YAY..food is delivered to our table, except missing half of our order. Some guy in a suit comes over, apologizes, wants to do whatever he can to make it right. Other half of order arrives, i say..Well comp that food we have waited an Hour & a half to get. He comes back, so sorry, can't do that. Well screw this place, and if you like to see airplanes take off & land, there's a nice little pull over on Sunset. You can do it for free.

We came for dinner. Service was a bit slow at first, but the food was amazing. Chili chicken and the chicken saag were our favorites al it with the tandoori chicken. Mild on all. And the view is awesome.

Beyond unprofessional!! Ordered pickup today. Was told through email and Yelp it would be ready in 10-35 minutes. Sent my son to pick our two meals up which totals $36.00. He went in and told them that we had a to go order to pick up and the man rudely told him to cancel the order that they wasn't going to fill it!? My son being the shy person he is didn't question it and called me as he left but what the hell kind of business is this?! If you aren't fulfilling my order then call me and don't waste my time! HORRIBLE service!!!
Delicious and authentic,Great view of Las Vegas strip.Enjoyed the air strip and friendly service.

Mediocre food and horrible service. Even though I love Indiana food and work nearby, today's lunch reminded me of why I don't come here. The lunch buffett is pretty mediocre, nothing really stands out. I don't know if the servers even speak English since they never spoke to me. They also never brought me any bread nor did they refill my water. More like busboys, really. And it being a lunch buffett, their responsibilities were minimal. So no friendly greeting, no inquiries about how I liked my food, no thanks for coming. Nothing. Completely ignored. That's how your HOSPITALITY business FAILS.
Fantastic food, most authentic I have had in a long time. Great atmosphere. Will recomemd to everyone I know.

Called to ask if they require reservations. After repeating my question four times and each time the man rudely responding, what time because we are very busy, I hung up. He could not simply answer if reservations were mandatory. Extremely rude. Have ordered take out here once but will not be dining again.

Came here for the lunch buffet which is $11.95/person I believe. Buffet has extensive options and there is a full bar. The restaurant reminds me of one from India, especially walking up the stairs and through the hallways, but it does have a pretty cool view of the airport's runways. The staff was a little scatter-brained and the food wasn't being refilled on time, but it was very tasty nonetheless. It'd be better if they included more options, like more desserts and chai in their buffet, but all in all, we'll be back. Parking was a little difficult because the lot got full, so you may have to go to the lot below the building.

If you are near the Vegas airport and in mood for an Indian bite before or after your flight this place will not disappoint. Their lunch buffet though is a much better deal. Food is better than your average Indian fare, but not outstanding.

2nd time here...if you want a great atmosphere plus great Indian food & friendly staff...come to this place! Plus there's a lounge to hang out with friends  even...best to come at night to see the planes & a view of the strip...I ordered the Channa masala & parents ordered the butter chicken & chicken tikka masala
Service was  excellent ... food was delicious .lassi wasn't too good. Environment seems fine.. kinda hot that day .

AMAZING SERVICE, delicious food, the drinks were out of this world , the ambiance was incredible and with a great view of the strip, our server Mani took care of me and my friend and explained all the different foods and ingredients, and our bartender Raj mixed us the most flavorous drinks. I will totally return here, perfect for a romantic date or a get together with friends!!!!!

It was my first time eating Indian food for the first time and I was really impressed. When we first walked in, it was a really nice restaurant and the staff was really nice. We ordered a cauliflower appetizer and it was really amazing. I'm not a huge fan of cauliflower but this was really good! I really recommend the buttered chicken because that was a whole new flavor to me. The spices, the flavor, everything about it was amazing! I'm definitely coming back!

Amazing food! The view is awesome! Mani, our waiter, was great and Nikita too! Thank you guys for a great experience:). My friend Jill and I had a great dinner! And they had live music. On our way out we checked out the Hookah Lounge there. Beautifully decorated, gave me a great feeling just standing in the room. I plan on going there and night. I definitely plan on eating at the restaurant again! Thanks again.

I found this restaurant on Group On. I've been looking for a good Indian restaurant since my favorite place closed a year ago. This is now my new favorite indian restaurant in Las Vegas. Amazing food!  Great service!  I love forward to eating here again and would openly recommend Pure India Cusine. It's close to the strip and has and amazing view of the airport and strip. Two yummy thumbs up! Thank you to Mani for being and awesome server and for making us laugh.

Delicious food which is the main great thing, but the view is awesome too! All of the food is consistently delicious and the service on point. Everything has great flavors and the rice is tasty. Hope to be back in the future!

Before coming to Pure Indian Cuisine, Indian food was not my first choice.  This food is amazing, this is my 3rd time here actually 2nd time this week.  I must say the service and the food is the best.  The waiter Mani is so helpful and nice.  It feels good to go to a restaurant that provides this level of service.

Butter chicken is great. Service is amazing, especially Mani who is very welcoming and attentive.
Beautiful views next to the airport and good hookas.
Will definitely come back the next time I visit

The food here was mediocre. The cashew base curry was delicious but the vegetable curry was below standard. We ordered the garlic and onion naan and they were quite small pieces versus what you can get at another restaurant. 

The server was nice, meaning he did what he had to do, but he was unhappy with his life, never smiled or make us feel welcome. 

The best thing is the view. I'd rather buy food elsewhere and enjoy the view by sitting outside next to the airport.

I went here with my boyfriend and best friend, last night. The food was wonderful! We ordered Garlic Naan, Roti, Navaratan Korma, Lamb Rogan Josh, and Butter Chicken. All of it was full flavored and left us wanting more. The service was amazing, as well. The server was very attentive and made great suggestions. It is clear that the owners take pride in their restaurant and their food. Their positivity and enthusiasm is contagious! I will definitely be visiting again!

We made a trip back based on our previous visit last year. Not worth at all - didn't feel like eating what they had to offer. Food seemed recycled, chicken was too dry . Maybe it's the new management or cooks - we are not coming back here.

I really can't stand a restaurant that charges a price different than what is advertised. Big sign outside says $10.99 lunch buffet Monday-Friday. We came at around 2:30pm on a Thursday and was charged $11.99 for the lunch buffet. It's not even about the price, but the principle. 

Food is good not great. Service is good, but not enough to upcharge. We won't be returning.
Excellent Indian food. Even though it's little far from the strip, it was totally worth it.

I wouldn't recommend this Indian restaurant.. I knew it they don't know how to cook meat dishes but friend of mine wants to try.. worse lamb gosh and lamb karahi I never had before.. worst place wasting money on meat dishes.
