I believe they use same spices and recipes for every single meat dishes all I have to say just don't waste your money on meat dishes.. lamb karahi just boiled meat and big piece of tomato and onions and excat same dish lamb josh and you never find out about both dishes what you eating lamb josh or lamb karahi. Worse place I ever been to.

Very nice establishment. A friend and I had dinner around 7pm. There was live music in addition to a great view! Of course,  the food was great! 

When you visit, ask for Mani... he's the best!

Treated my cousin to a birthday dinner here since we love Indian cuisine and haven't had it in a while. Not a lot of people I know here do. Found this place on Yelp with good reviews and I thought it's a nice location away from the strip. The view of the airport and strip in the background is beautiful, our server Mani was great and the food was delicious. I have a friends from India who have spoiled me with authentic dishes, so I've been dissatisfied with most restaurants I've been to where the dishes are too salty for my taste. Indian food can be, but I don't eat a lot of salty foods. This place seasoned their dishes perfectly. Not greasy or salty.

I ordered the dishes I love for Michelle to try: Navaratan Korma (creamy veggie cashew dish), Palak Paneer (spinach and Indian cheese), dishes came with basmati rice and we ordered two types of naan - garlic and a naturally sweet one (forgot the name) with figs and nuts.  

When we were seated, we were immediately served with water, asked for drink order and server returned with a complimentary variety  of chutney and Indian 'crisps' like chips (forgot the name for it!).  Finished off dinner with traditional Masala Chai. It was Michelle's first time trying authentic chai. She loved it as I do.

We were satisfied with our vegetarian dinner. No bloating from salty Indian cuisine is a plus. Will come back again to try their lunch buffet and other menu items!

 In addition, they have live dinner music - Mr Montgomery played some smooth jazz reggae fusion that night.  They also have hookah at 7pm in another room.

My mom and I tried this place after she picked me up from the airport. The ambiance was very modern/chic (great date night spot), the service was excellent (shout out to our server manny) and the food was superb. 

I highly recommend this place!
Very nice place ... good food ... very near to airport ... view is very nice from 1st flour ... really liked the place

Went late night with my girlfriend for some lamb and chicken vindaloo. Both were prepared perfectly and so was the garlic naan. Great draft beers and an amazing view this might have to be one of my new regular spots in Vegas! 5/5

Amazing food, atmosphere overlooking the view of the strip! Service was very prompt. Food was amazing! We had the lamb and butter chicken. Definitely going to bring our friends and family here. Our waiter took the best date night pictures too! 5 star rating!

In a bit of an unusual location on the second floor above Fresh Kabob on Sunset just west of Spencer.

Parking lot is small but there is a parking garage under the building with an elevator to the second floor.

I've only been for lunch but I can say that the buffet is worth the money and shouldn't be missed.

Great to see some good Indian in this part of town!
I have a pretty strong stomach, I've traveled overseas, I've ATE THE STREET FOOD, and since eating here I haven't taken a solid shit in 3 days.

Located right across the street from the airport runway viewing area on the second floor, you get a meal with a view! Came in for the lunch buffet on a Friday.  Place is spacious and clean.  We were welcomed and sat as soon as we got in.  Staff was professional and friendly.  Once we got seated at our table, we hit buffet hard!!  I don't know what all the dishes are called, but what I do recall are the tandoori chicken, chili chicken (a little spicy), and goat curry.  I think I ate everything on the buffet line twice.  We got plain and garlic naan.  All of the food was good, no complaints.  I would say half of the buffet had vegetarian options and the other half had delicious meat options.

Good food but poor service. I have gone in for the lunch buffet 3 times and dinner twice - I prefer the lunch buffet because the food is great and I don't have to wait on the waiters. The staff typically hangs out around the bar so when you walk in, it takes a moment for them to notice you before you get seated. Then they are just extremely slow or not even present. A few times, I'm confident I could have just left with out paying because there was just no staff around and no waiter bringing me my check... but the food is excellent. My favorite thing the the cheese naan!

I been here for my first time this restaurant it's near by view point for see all airplane landing and take off nice view. 
But service is not really good and have just only one speak English very well (maybe that Manager) but another speak but not really good for take order on table. And my spoon is fall but no one take new for me. And the cheese curry is so salty also eggplant curry too.

This place just opened last Sunday. If you love Indian food you will love this buffet. The owner even stopped by to see how we liked the food. The naan was the freshest I have ever had. Stop by in the evening and check out the fabulous view of the Airport and strip, a full bar and a full service hookah lounge.
Awesome food, awesome service, awesome view at a great price. I was surprised. I'll be coming back!

I went to Groupon for looking indian  food in las Vegas. I found this gem called pure indian cuisine.  Food was past excellent. Everything was so o good . So the service. Mani the server was very helpful.. He surely need a raise  .. keep it up guys.
Drove on from Cali before a red eye. Close to the airport. Best garlic naan ever. Chicken Tikka and Vindaloo were awesome. Service was great.

This place rocks... Cannot say enough good things about the food. Mani is a great host and always goes the extra mile to ensure food and customer experience is A++. I cook Indian food so giving this place 5 stars take the extra mile from me!!!
Food was absolutely incredible! Reasonably priced and the portions were appropriate. I'd like to thank our server Garry Singh, who was very attentive and welcoming. Will definitely come back!!

Great spot!!!!
I love that this place is on the 2nd floor and has a great view of the planes taking off and landing.
The server was very mic and manager very attentive.
We ordered the butter chicken and chicken tikka masala and shrimp masala and all at a mild temp.
Next time I could go with a spicier temp.
Samosa and garlic naan are also great.
We will be back....can't wait to try lunch buffet
Went for lunch buffet. The food was lukewarm and there was mostly sauce with a little meat in the buffet trays. Service was mediocre to non-existent. Best item was the chutney.

I have been coming to this restaurant abt a year. I always have buffet here on my lunch break. Let me tell they are always on top of everything.  

Food is always fresh. Always new things in buffet. Service is great friendly. Mani the manager always take care of me. I am glad they opened near my work.
This is highly recommended great service! Seems very authentic and quality ingredients and portions not to mention the nice views of the airport. Will come back here again.

Love their food perfect spice. Beautiful view of the strip and watch the planes land at McCarron. 
Service is timed perfectly. Has full bar as well as buffet daily between 11 and 3.

Don't know much about Indian food, but this was delicious. 
Had the Chicken Tikka and a vegetarian dish. 

Amazing!

Plus the views are amazing. 
Brought my parents for a second trip. They never had Indian, both loved it as well. 
:)
Had dinner there tonight Was  food great , and ambience , and greet View of planes landing VERY COOL service was great I had the chicken curry YUMMY

So I'm a Brit living in Vegas, I've eaten everywhere from Mint (Good but not legendary) to Turmeric (Too spicy and trying to hard) this place wins my favorite Indian in town. 

Great presentation, amazing flavors, chicken. Poked to perfection. I'm officially impressed!

We used the Groupon towards paneer, and tikka masala. So wonderful! My hubby is so apprehensive about Indian food and he really liked this. It wasn't too salty and was flavored just right! We will absolutely be back to try other dishes and to try the lunch buffet. Service was excellent/ super attentive! We will bring our friends too! Great deal for the lunch buffet!

Everything about this place is cool - hidden away...all windows...watching planes land... Oh, and the food is fabulous.

I almost didn't want to write this review because it's always empty when I come in here, which is part of the appeal, but I guess other people have to come too if it's going to stay in business...

I have never eaten Indian food before and I'm not real adventurous but I really enjoyed this restaurant.  The staff was very nice and our waiter was very sweet and answered all our questions.  I would definitely go back.  I liked the location, we were able to see the planes land at mccarran. 
This was a good experience.

Good ambiance, excellent serving but taste of food is worst. We ordered veg curries he just dumped frozen packets and added masala. Indian cooking takes time but it more tasted like fast food with boiled vegetables and masala powder not cooked.

Okay so I've tried a new Indian place every other week here in Las Vegas off and on for about 6 months. Most of them didn't even have buttered chicken or Naan!! This place though, amazing Stuffed Naan with yogurt dip, then the lamb vindaloo was so delicious and spicy( they ask you how hott you want it). I was really amazed how big their menu was so many dishes to try and a really great atmosphere being that this place is on the second floor overlooking the airport. Just for myself I spent about 30 dollars on my meal Naan vindaloo and Taj Mahal beer but they do have a 10 dollar buffet for peeps that don't wanna spend a lot. Bottom line you want some outstanding authentic Indian food without taking a long international flight or dating an Indian girl and service to match GO TO PURE INDIAN CUISINE!!! I will post pictures next visit unfortunately I ate it all too fast okay had lunch and dinner here in the same day dinner butter chicken cheese naan so amazing and served enough for five but I ate it all soooooo good

I had a Groupon for this restaurant and decided to check it out with my brother. It can be slightly confusing to find this restaurant since the lit-up sign does not actually say "Pure Indian Cuisine," but just follow the paper signs up to the entrance on the second floor. The atmosphere is quite modern and hip, and there are large windows with amazing views of the airport tarmac just across the street. This would make a great date place!

We were given some complimentary papadam to start, which also came with mint and tamarind chutneys. Service was friendly. I will say that it took quite a while before our food came out, but I suppose they make everything to order.

Unfortunately, the portions were not the biggest, so even after two entrees and an order of garlic naan, my brother and I were not full. The garlic naan was a decent size (four pieces) for the price though, and the eggplant and chicken dishes we ordered were very flavorful and tasty. 

There was also live music when we visited, which was nice.

Overall, this is a very pleasant restaurant, but maybe consider coming for the lunch buffet if you are super hungry; it would yield better bang for your buck.

Okay, the fact that this restaurant is located across from the airport on the second floor allows for pretty nice views -- the Strip skyline in the distance peppered periodically with planes making their descent into Vegas. I'll round up a star for that alone. You can ponder the logistics of aviation while waiting for your complimentary papadum and chutney. (The minty green sauce is better than the red.)

The entrance is a little odd. You walk in through some double doors, either take the elevator or stairs, pass the hookah lounge, and make a turn at the long hallway. We went on a Sunday evening. There were about two other tables there. One of them consisted of tourists, clad in Vegas memorabilia, and the other was an Indian family, so that's a good sign. 

I got the PALAK PANEER ($14) while my dad got the LAMB KARAHI ($16). Both came with Basmati rice, but it was merged onto one plate (could've used another scoop or so). We also got an order of the garlic naan, but it was served kind of cold. My entree was the palak paneer, which is my favorite Indian dish. I barely ate a third of it and got full. No one thinks you can get full off of pureed spinach and cheese cubes, but those spices and seasonings do their job of pumping up the flavor. I didn't try the lamb because I'm not a fan of gamey meats, but my dad said it was good. So there you go.

Service was mediocre. Our two waiters didn't seem too friendly. Also, it was Easter and so I called ahead to make sure I could use my Groupon and the lady had said yes. When I tried to redeem it, one of the waiters was adamant in declining it. (In fine print, it states not valid on federal holidays, but Easter isn't a federal holiday.) He replied that he had not been accepting them all day. Well, I guess those grouponers got swindled. He ended up redeeming mine after I explained I had called in to check. There was a lady bussing tables that day and she was the friendliest out of all them.

Overall, Pure Indian Cuisine has a great location/view, worth checking out with the Groupon. I'd stop by again, but it's not my favorite. There are plenty of Indian restaurants in the city deservedly vying for your visit.

The food was average; the variety was less than average. I probably wont return unless I'm hosting a visitor who is in to aviation 
The view of the aircraft landing across the street is sensational! 
Plenty of parking, kind staff.

Came here for the first time. Food was pretty good, nice ambience, nice views of the strip. Loved the mango lassi. Just the staff was alittle noisy forgetting our order. Dropping someone's else's order on our table. Yelling across the floor of peoples drink orders and food orders. Otherwise food was amazing.

The food here is very good, and the view of the airport and Strip beyond is entertaining. The lunch buffet is a great value and an opportunity to try everything without having to know the names. At dinner service is spotty, and the wait staff aren't particularly friendly. If you use a Groupon (not good for the buffet) be sure to read the rules. They will try to make you order more than you are required by Groupon.

The service was amazing! They were all so kind :) as for the food, it was really good! The only reason why I put 4 stars is because I've had better Indian food that BLEW MY MIND like crazy! But their food was still amazing! I don't eat spicy food but I finished the whole lamb vindaloo because oh gosh wowwwww it was good (and drank milk after though ofcourse to calm the spice in my mouth hehe). :)

Really really amazing Indian food. My friends and I are visiting from Denver & wish they had a location out there. Perfect place near the strip to go, relax, and eat. Beautiful view of the city. Great service & clean! Thank you! We are glad we got to eat here :)

I had the chicken korma and it was the best I ever had. Delicious!!!! The ordered the bread cooked with lamb inside. Also some appetizers of vegetables that were excellent.. I am so glad to have found this spot. Beautiful view of airport and live music. I love the Indian beer also

Great atmosphere and food. The restaurant is on the top floor. Fantastic view. Parts are very large, and the food is delicious. The waiter was very friendly and explained the options for eating with a smile. So, if you want to get a great experience, then he is here.

we came here for lunch today. The first thing caught my eye was the beautiful view of the Strip and airport.  

It is situated in a little shopping center on the 2nd floor, on Sunset road. Once seated I couldn't stop looking at the view of Las Vegas as well as the planes land and take off.

The food we ordered are -
Pure Indian Mix Grill $21.00-Tandoori chicken, chicken tikka, sheekh kabob and shrimp tandoori. This is good variety to try.

Shrimp Korma $17.00-shrimp soaked in a special almond and saffron sauce. Served with basmati rice. The sauce was indeed special.

Kabuli Naan $4.00-bread stuffed with cashews, pistachios, raisins and dates. 
 and for drink -mango lassi. The Nan was so tasty and the food were delectable.

The waitress was attentive. There was a live music, musician Milo was good playing some Jazz.

We will be back to try buffet and dinner must be a beautiful view at night.

This Indian restaurant is off the beaten path of the strip. You could miss it driving by its on the second floor of a office building over looking the LAS runway. Really cool setting!. Everything here is made to offer you can't go wrong. The food was amazing, we had the: chicken tikka masala, lamb biyani, and chicken vindaloo all were amazing, perfect blend of spices. Don't forget the garlic naan and dessert. Thanks for a great date night!!

Stopped by for a quick caffeine fix after an exhausting morning with my toddler. Ordered a masala chai which mad made from scratch. Yummy! 

Also ordered 1 naan which was authentic and delicious.

Came here for $10.99 lunch buffet because I was in the area and they have good reviews on Yelp.
This place is located in the back of "Fresh Kabob" which is facing Sunset Rd. It's on the second floor so you have to take the stairs or the elevator. 
As soon as I walked in, I was wowed by the view of the runway with the plane taking off!!
I was welcomed by the waitress, Nikita. She was nice and sweet.
There are so many different curries in the buffet area. From vegetarian ones to chicken ones to lamb ones!! I tried everything and they were all delicious. The chicken was tender and flavorful. I liked "Navaratan Korma". It's cashew nuts pasted curry. Nice sweet taste but a bit spicy. It was delicious with their garlic naan. 
I met a guy here that explained me about all of their vegetarian curries (How nice!). He said he's a vegetarian and he comes here every week. So, if you are a vegetarian and love Indian food, you still have a lot of choices you can eat at this place!! Vegetarian friendly.
I'd love to come back here at night for the view!!

I have been to Pure Indian many times since I first reviewed it several years ago.  I must say that I have never been disappointed and tonight's meal was no exception.  We had butter chicken, palak paneer and lamb josh rogan.  All were gourmet level, savory and delicious.  The garlic nan just melted in our mouths!   In addition to the exciting views of the Strip and the McCarran landing runway, they have also added a musician on the weekend playing soothing, dinner conversation-appropriate, contemporary tunes.  Service was excellent and the management very caring.  Mani is best.If you haven't tried Pure India, you're not enjoying the best in Las Vegas Indian cuisine!

Have been here twice for dinner and the food is always delicious; the servers are cheerful, prompt and always happy to answer questions or make suggestions. We will be back for sure!

The view of the city and the airport is a bonus!
I stop by on the way home from work. It's nice and peaceful. The food is always great! I think it is the best Indian food!

If you're coming here for the buffet, don't. They have the smallest selection I've ever seen, most of the food was cold, and the only two things that I thought were safe to eat were so salty to the point of being nearly inedible. The chicken was stone cold. The waitress ignored us the whole time, and the restaurant was pretty dirty at the time. You know it's not the best Indian buffet when there are french fries in the buffet line. Bottom line, skip it.
Awesome friendly great service and open late for all the graveyard people in this town...also great view of airplanes coming and going..

Second time stopping by this place and again thoroughly enjoyed the food. They also have a great view of the airport and strip.

Nice atmosphere and pleasant service.

Far from home but one of the few Indian restaurants open late. Worth the drive. I had an amazing first time experience here. Not too familiar with Indian cuisine so we got really great recommendations from our server, Mani and all were just impeccable. I'm not big fan of lamb dishes but the Lamb Korma was just to die for. It had a perfect balance of nutty, sweet, and spicy. The lamb itself was very tender as if the dish was slow cooked for hours. From our appetizer, main dishes and Indian brewed beer, Mani has really set the course of our entire meal and exceeded our expectations. It was also obvious he had a great support team to help him and this restaurant shine.

Had a GREAT evening with AMAZING food! The service was excellent and everything Mani recommends is a big hit! The cauliflower appetizer, chicken tikka masala, lamb tikka masala, lamb and spinach, naan, mango and pistachio ice cream was delicious! Our second time here and Mani remembered us, and exactly where we sat our first time here! That's what you call excellent customer service! If you want tasty and authentic Indian food, COME HERE!

The absolute best Indian food anywhere!!

We're in Las Vegas for meetings and crave Indian food. A local recommended Pure Indian and it is the best Indian food we've had since London!! 
We travel all over the world and food is one of the highlights and for Indian food, there's no need to go far with Pure Indian. 
If you love flavorful foods and the best quality, I highly recommend that you try them out. 
They have a lunch buffet and weekend brunch. 
The service is impeccable, everyone is so nice. It's family owned and they love to chat. 
I have been here twice and wished they were in Ca. Until then it's my go-to restaurant.
came here for dinner tonight.. amazing food, amazing service!! i seriously cannot get over the taste in food.. so delicious!! btw overlooks the airport very nice view!

Me and my family went for the lunch buffet and were totally satisfied with everything when we left. The food,service and ambience were overwhelming. We tried everything from the buffet. Everything was so fresh and tasty. The flavours were authentic, also the naan was freshly brought to table. The service was impeccable. Everyone were nice and friendly. Will be surely back for dinner.

We are Indian foodies and happened upon Pure Indian this PM. All we can say is outstanding!  The goat vindaloo and palak paneer are fabulous!  And be sure to have pistachio kulfe for dessert. Definitely the new "best Indian" restaurant  in LV!

The food is amazing. We don't do buffets so ordered off the menu. We had chicken tikka, chicken tikka masala and the butter chicken. We also had a few appetizers. All ordered mild as we're wimps, but the food was excellent. The only odd part of this place is the hostess/server (she provides water, menus, etc) had water in hand, had given us water glasses but still took a good 5 minutes to get water. It was bizarre because she came to the table with the water pitcher, walked away with it, walked around the restaurant with it (filling others' glasses) and finally got to us again. We've been here twice and twice the same server/same issue. Otherwise it's a 5 star place!

Great view! And he food was outstanding! We ordered the Lamb Biryani, chicken tikka Marsala, Pilak Paneer and garlic naan! Manny was a fantastic server and helped out with the suggestions. If you like or are curious about Indian food, this place is a must! We will be back!

Found this place through Groupon and came out for dinner with a group of business partners. Although I like those deals I'm always a bit bit weary that I may get blindsided with disappointed. Therefore I cross reference with Yelp! Fellow yelpers are totally on point with how fabulous the location is. The view of the planes taking off (and at dusk) was spectacular. So big thumbs up for that! The service was very good, Cash was our server. We had a bit of confusion with our groupon and he was very helpful in resolving the matter smoothfully. Being an Atlanta Native I've been lucky emough to experience dozens of Indian restaurants (ie.street food, Gujurati vegeterian, North and South Indian to name some) so the food did not get me too hyped up. It was descent, the spices we're a bit off for my taste. I can def say that their portions are very nice. We ordered 5 meat entrees, 4 vegetarian, an order of Nan and a Roti, and 3 appetizers. The white rice was a complimentary, and 4 were brought to us. We had two bags full of to go containers filled to the top with a little of everything. This was enough food for another full meal for all 7 of us. Side note-the roti was not the type of roti we expected to get. It was more like a lighter and crispier version of their nan. So their spices weren't my fav, but for sure expect a great view, some good service and tons of food!

I love Indian food and I thought that I had found a good Indian restaurant with Pure.  But no.  Today, they delivered some truly disgusting food to me.  I asked for Mild spiciness and it was crazy spicy.  The curry was also just not right - nothing like I had previously gotten when I ordered.  I couldn't even eat it.  This was the first Indian food that I ever threw into the garbage.  I have had good food from Pure in the past and I have no idea why they suddenly made such horrible "food" ( I always tip well).  But if getting this slop is even possible then I can never order from them again.  Oh, and they offered no apology or explanation for the terrible, inedible "food."  I am so sad because I love Indian food and I thought that Pure was good - and now I have to look elsewhere.

This is my favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas!! I'm so happy my friend brought me, I simply can not get enough. Highly recommend it! 
Kristine

Yummy! I was originally taken aback by the "weirdness" of the restaurant, the business park-right by the airport- office building looking - neon sign hanging - hookah lounge - VIP lounge - fully stocked bar - tons of tvs - mural paintings - lunch buffet - open till 3am weirdness. 

The service was excellent and the food was awesome. I mean some of the best Indian I've ever had. 
Our recommended dishes are:
 - Chicken curry
Chicken Korma
 - Cheese garlic naan
 - Veggie curry with chicken (not on menu)

Obviously, the view. 
It was fine. I wouldn't get all crazy about this place. Service was good and it's cool that they identify what's vegan and what's not but I wasn't really impressed. Came for dinner, no idea what lunch buffet is like.
We have lived here for 10 years and just discovered this place! How did we not know?! Great lunch buffet. Beautiful views of the airport.

We ordered delivery and I cannot day enough good stuff!!  Food came quick and hot, and SOOOOO YUMMY!! I have been struggling since getting back from India to find authentic Indian food with lots of flavor and spice that isn't watered down or full of butter, tomato or cream as filler.  Everything was super flavorful, even the white rice had whole peppercorn and coriander in it... they really went the extra mile to make sure that the food was an experience and that each component was flavorful.  Just be mindful that's what you're getting, lots of flavor and lots of spice... so if you're used to bland, creamy, mild, weak stuff, it's not going to be for you....
We absolutely love this place! We come once a week, food never fails to come out amazing!

Surprising little gem! 

Walking into the downstairs of the building, you wouldn't guess what you're going to find in the upstairs. It's kind of shady feeling, and normally I'd have taken one sniff of the lingering cigarette smoke and walked out. However (and thankfully), once we made it upstairs and figured out that it was NOT in the hookah place next door, it was quite a relief to see an airy, clean restaurant space to walk into. 

There are big windows where you can watch the planes take off and land while you have your meal, and enjoy the sun (or lights). 

The food. Yes, the food. Definitely some of the best we've had in the city, especially for a very reasonable $12.00 lunch buffet. 

The salad fare was standard stuff. I wish I'd taken pics of the rest of the buffet, but I was too damn hungry to remember..LOL. 

After taking our drink orders, the waitress brought a combination basket of plain and garlic naan to the table, that was obviously right out of the oven. It was thicker/more doughy than I personally prefer, but still very good. I like it thinner so I don't fill up so easily, and also to sop up the sauces better. 
The palak paneer and butter chicken were the standouts for us. Perfectly creamy and lots of flavor. The spinach was slightly spicy, just the way it should be. 
The vegetable korma was also well flavored and not bland. The chicken tikka was rather dry, but the fresh batch they brought out was just fine. 

There were a couple of other chicken dishes that were tasty as well, but my favorite dish hands down was the curried goat. Lots of flavor layers and decent chunks of meat amongst all of the little bones. (why there always are so many in goat meat, I have no idea...I don't recall seeing micro goats with micro bones everywhere..lol).
That was really that only purpose for me to have any rice at all on my plate...just so I wouldn't lose that yummy sauce! 

Service overall was pleasant. Our water glasses were kept full, though we did have to ask for more naan, and it wasn't busy when we were eating. 

The rice pudding was good, nothing unusual though. The mango "custard" was very sweet, cloyingly so for me. I'd never had it before, and a woman diner warned me about the sugar and how it was more to be used in small amounts, like a dip . It was not custard like at all in presentation, more like a somewhat thin pudding consistency. Maybe that's standard, I don't know, but just throwing the discrepancy out there. 

Anyway, we found the place to be worthy of a review, and we will definitely return once I can risk the million calories again :-)

**UPDATE**:  Upon making a second trip here, I have to say I'm pretty disappointed. The quality of the first visit just wasn't there this time, and so, I'll likely continue going to Mt. Everest instead as they are quite consistent, and very accommodating there. My initial review was 4 stars here, and I've adjusted it down to 3.
Yummy food, cool ambience with a great view of planes landing. Try the saffron and peach cocktail.

If this were closer to where I live, I'd be there much too often.  Pure Indian Cuisine combines two of my favorite things--good Indian food and a view of planes taking off and landing right across Sunset Road.

I came here with two friends yesterday for the lunch buffet.  The price as mentioned in reviews is $10.99 which includes naan.  After we were seated, we just chatted for awhile catching up on  news (OK, gossip) each one of us had to give.  A young woman from the restaurant came by and told us politely that we could go to the buffet anytime we wanted.  She held off ordering naan for us until she saw us go to the buffet.

One of the first things I chose was the papdi chaat.  This is the first Indian buffet that I remember serving any kind of chaat and it was very good!  I also tried the pakora mix, mutter paneer, and navaratan korma.  Everything was very good.  As we were starting, the server brought our garlic naan and it had a great garlic flavor.  For my second plate, I got some butter chicken and more standard Indian fare.  For dessert. I got a small bowl of mango custard and one of of kheer.  Both were delightful.  

Service was very good.  Our water was refilled several times.

I need to go back for dinner and try their regular evening menu.  Oh, yes, and I need to see some more planes.  The restaurant is right across from the Sunset Road parking area for McCarran so it's easy to find.

Had lunch with friends. Excellent food. Ordered Palak's paneer, kadahi paneer, chicken tikka masala, naan and chicken biryani. Everyone enjoyed the food. Great views of the airport and strip from the hotel

Best Indian food in vegas so far and they are brand new! Amazing view of the strip and an absolutely amazing staff. Garry and his wife Nimi are the best and Nimitz makes the best Nan ever!! And Mani topped it off with great service.. I'm bringing everyone here!!

We both had different types of chicken and they were both very very good every part of the food dishes was very authentic and it was obvious that this place caters to people from India as almost all the people in here were Indian.  If you come for lunch the lunch buffet is the best value for the money

Delicious food and amazing staff.
Shahi paneer, butter chicken recommended. 
Had a flight to catch, they had very fast service.

Rasmalai and gulab jamun recommended.
Got free gulab jamun on the house.

I love Indian food and this is the best I've ever had. Every time I come to Vegas I will be eating here at least once. The goat curry was phenomenal. It was very tender and spicy. Mani was a wonderful host, very friendly. Brian was a magician that does magic for you while you wait for your food. A very unique experience and again, food was bomb!!!
Delicious Indian food with a beautiful view of the planes taking off and landing! An awesome way to enjoy a dinner out! Hookah lounge connected.

Pros:
- Butter chicken & Palak Paneer was really good.
- Ambiance was warm and modern
- Service was very friendly
- Restrooms were clean

Cons: 
- Service was extremely slow
- Naan was a bit hard
- Music coming from the Hooka Lounge was too loud.

I would reccomend this restraunt.
Good and fresh lots of wonderful flavors did not expect to eat at the buffet but went for it not bad try the goat very nice However the chicken dish there was raw but those kind of things happen

Pure Indian has the most delicious and authentic food with a beautiful view. We never order the same thing and have never been disappointed. the handsome server delivered the most delicious warm sweet balls for desert tonight. Loved them! Maniii ur the bestt

You take the good. You take the bad. You take them both and there you have my mixed impressions of Pure Indian Cuisine. Only the bad isn't really bad. Simply a matter of my expectations being inaccurate.

I found a Groupon offer for Pure Indian Cuisine and saw that my Yelp friends had given it good reviews. So of course I had to try it. My Groupon offer was valued at $30 so I had to get a few items from the menu. Darn the luck. I tend to plan my adventures out so I knew going in what I wanted to try. I diverted from my path slightly. 

To start, I was brought the customary papadum and sauces. This was some of the best papadum I've had and the sauces were very herbacious and HOT. Well, not overwhelming but they woke up my taste buds.

On to my order, I knew for sure I wanted to try the homemade Indian tea, vegetable samosas and garlic naan. The tea and samosas came out first. I was expecting a hot tea. This was not hot. Nor was a iced. I suppose tepid is the right word. A tea with cardamom and milk. It was fine just not what I had in mind when I ordered. I was offered a refill but I declined. It wasn't necessary. The samosas were pleasing to the eye. A good size and crisp. Lets not forget hot and fresh too. The potato and pea filling was on the dry side so I spooned some of the leftover papadum sauce onto them. The naan came out with my meal.

For my entree I ordered chicken korma. I changed my mind from chicken jalfrezi which was a departure from the Punjabi chicken I orginally wanted. Either way I was getting something I had not tried before. The korma was a perfect choice. Indian food has such remarkable depth of flavor which is why I love it so very much. This was no exception. The sauce was rich and creamy with a subtle hint of nuttiness from the cashews. It was so soothing. And the chicken was tender. Of course I had to spoon it over the rice which on its own was stellar. Some of the best rice I've had any where regardless of cultural origin. Long grains of seasoned rice that I could make a meal of by itself. Finally the naan. I ordered garlic naan and there was no small amount of garlic on it. It was loaded. The bread thinner than I am used to. And more charred to crispy. Perhaps more authentic than the chewy pizza crust style I usually get. It was different but good in its own right.

At the end of the evening I spent $28 of the $30 voucher I had. Not bad. Plus I brought home some leftovers for lunch. Score. I got to see the planes taking off and landing. And I was called "dah-ling" by my waitress with the ever so slight New York accent. All in all it was pretty good meal that left me full and content.

My girlfriend and I came for the hookah and the Indian food, absolutely amazing lamb bindulo and taj mahal beer! Mani, our server was so awesome. Las Vegas needs more servers like him. Will be coming back soon!

Our view was spectacular of the Las Vegas strip night lights...This is my first time, the food and service excellent... Highly Recommended, our server Mani was very helpful, and assisted in made some delicious entree suggestion, and we got to meet "Aunty", who made our fresh delicious Naan.
I like the Lamb Briyani. Execellent curry!  Mani the manager is very pleasant and friendly. Definitely a repeat.

Pretty good Indian restaurant. I've only been to the buffet, but the selection is great. Loved the sag paneer, tiki masala and curry chicken as well as the vegetarian dishes. Nice view of the airport runway where you can view the planes landing and taking off.

Service and quality are top notch!!!! Great spot with a restaurant, hookah lounge and banquet hall. All in 1 spot!!!!! I personally sat in the hookah lounge with a friend and was able have great girl time over drinks and hookah. The lounge has a relaxing (not over crowded occupancy), intimate ambiance with authentic indian music and food to accompany.  Hector (hookah guru) and Raj (manager) were sooooo helpful with hookah and food menu items, they truly were welcoming and have great service. I know for sure this is my new favorite hang out spot!!!!

One of the best Indian restaurants in town. Food is always fresh. The view is spectacular to say the least.

You can taste the love in the way the food is seasoned to perfection. One of their best items is the Chili chicken which is usually a buffet item on Fridays. Buffet items consist of 4 different meat dishes in addition to 6 vegetable type dishes:

Goat curry - standard dish
Butter chicken - standard dish
Chicken Tandoori - standard dish

Navaratan korma - standard dish
Palak paneer - standard dish 

Let's talk about dinner, of course it turns into fine dining and is brought out in splendid Indian flavor.

As a repeat customer I've found myself making friends with other repeat customers.

The gang at Pure Indian Cuisine go out of their way to make your visit a memorable one so that you come back and it works. Go visit you'll be glad you did!!!

The Buffet is awesome a broad selection of delicious Indian food. Service is the best the beer Taja excellent  we will be back   FYI park in lower level take elevator to 2nd floor restaurant next to Lounge.

I really enjoy this place. Its a little hard to find, upstairs from Kabob, next to Hookah Lounge. The buffet is open 11am- 3pm and has a lot of great selections, especially if you are new to Indian food and not sure what you'd like. Buffet is the way to go!
My husband & I have also gone for dinner. We got a couple of appetizers and split an entree, totaling $30- with leftovers! Such a great deal and delish food!
The only recommendation I would make is better quality in service.

Attentive service and delicious food. I love the second floor location with huge windows so you can see airplanes land and take off. Still very quiet in the restaurant though. We had a spinach aloo,  Channa Massala and an unusual dish of vegetable dumpings in a sweet sauce that were all fabulous. The spicy cauliflower appetizer was flavorful as well. We ordered a heat level of 6 (out of 10), which I thought was more like a 4 or 5.  Nice, friendly staff.

Came here for the buffet around 1130 ish.  Very clean environment, friendly service, terrific view of the airport.  Everything I had was delicious.  I wish I could name one thing that stood out but everything was good. Can't go wrong. Definitely recommend this place and will be coming back.
Worst Indian buffet I have had. All food including rice, rotis were cold. Dal Makhani was salty. No one was even bothered to heat the food. Never going to be here again.

Great food and a beautiful view. I love the chili chicken and lamb basmati dishes and they can be made custom to your desired spice level. Mani helped us with our order and was very helpful with getting familiar with the food.
Great service and great food! Carlos is the best server. Nice atmosphere and amazing view! Love it. Can't wait to come back.

Very close to work and it is on the 2nd story so there is a fabulous view of the strip. This is especially nice with all the construction lately. It is buffet style and they change their dishes daily. I have co-workers come into town regularly and we stop by at least once a week. The staff is extremely friendly and they ask you how the food is and will actually make it more or less spicy! You have a choice of garlic or plain naan. Very fresh and delicious! They raised prices recently :( It was $9.99 an now I believe it is $11.99 per person. However, not enough of an increase to keep me from visiting. Since most visitors I bring are on business, we need separate checks. They are happy to help. I like this because some restaurants really give you attitude for separate checks. Maybe a frequent diner card?

Seems to be run by cheap person ,whose only objective is to use Groupon to bring some customers and once they are inside restaurant , rob them . I had very bad experience during my last Vegas trip as bought a groupon and went there to have lunch . While buying Groupon there was no condition upfront but as soon I went inside ,owner has put some conditions to accept Groupon coupon . 
I have reported this to Groupon . Please be aware of this restaurant.

Second time at Pure Indian. something about their curries really draw me to this restaurant. Unique and flavorful. Quality curries I can't get at just any Indian restaurant. 

After being introduced to pure Indian I instantly fell in love given I work in aviation. I dragged another Flight Attendant along to share the joy of the spectacular views of the airplanes taking off and landing from the restaurant table. 

Some of my favorite dishes at pure Indian:
1. Saag
2. Tikka masala
3. Josh Rogan

Try their stuffed tikka naan for a twist on your normal naan bread next time
Butter Chicken was the best. Brunch included drink $13.99. Service was great! View of strip and airport were lovely! Buffet has lots of variety! Great spices and bread.
This place is amazing!!  Definitely coming back to try their lunch buffet.   The samosas are incredible.  Must try. !!!

So I have come here several times after my first wonderful experience hoping it would take me back to that very satisfying time.   Sadly I feel while the food is not bad by any means,  the evolved flavor profiles have been lost while the amount of salt has increased.   In addition some items were just bad,  like the veggie pakora  was more chewy and dense than crispy.   It's a shame, and I hope they make the changes needed to have the same quality they offered when first opening.
Great food.  Great service.  Great view and location.  Come check it out and ask for Meni to be your server.  Definitely will be back.

Best butter chicken I have ever had! Amazing spices. So happy that I am going to eat here again on my trip. IN my opinion the mild is a great spice level, if you are between spice levels... order down.

This food is the real deal. The view of the airport is awesome too! It's super confusing getting up to the restaurant itself, but the interior is very nice and inviting. Large TVs, tons of tables, and even a VIP room. The lunch buffet was incredible, lots of options. I think this place had the best butter chicken I have ever eaten. Great service as well. Will definitely be back soon!

I made it in recently for the lunch buffet that is offered on weekdays. I really enjoyed the food and low key atmosphere.

The restaurant is a hidden gem. Even though I work close and have been to the Kabob spot below I had no idea Pure Indian existed. The restaurant was easy to find after reading directions from other reviewers. The restaurant is simple and clean. The dining area is quiet which makes it a nice option for a relaxing lunch. 

The lunch buffet is $10.99 which was a great value for the variety and quality of the food. There were plenty of options for carnivores and vegetarians alike. Upon being seated we were offered plain or garlic naan. We ended up trying both and I loved both. The plain might be better if you are using the naan to scoop up sauces. The buffet has all of the fixings for a green salad, several meat entrees, several vegetarian entrees, chutneys, sides, and a dessert option. Everything I tasted was delicious and flavorful. Dishes were clearly labeled to help in choosing favorites.

Delicious Indian food!  The buffet is only $10.99 during the week and  $12.99 during the weekend (you get a drink with your meal on the weekend).  

You get your choice of fresh regular or garlic naan to go along with your food.  Garlic naan is my favorite!

I love this place. Good Indian food, though possibly not quite the best in town. But it's still very well done. The service has always been good to me. I won't lie, I freaking love the view. Come in during the day so you can watch the planes taking off and landing at the airport.

The food in this place is AWESOME. Mani the manager is one of the best guys I've ever met, he really takes care of his customers. I will recommend this restaurant to anybody. Really good service and the restaurant is very cosy.

This place was ok. The entrees are very expensive and compared to the Indian places we've visited, the tikka masala and butter chicken were both very tomato flavored. Ketchup overload. The rice was good, the lentil soup was good. The view is AMAZING. We got to watch plans land and take off and my kids were in heaven. You can see the lights from the strip at night too.

My boyfriend and I came here on vacation. We got a sweet deal on groupon for this place.

We got chicken Tika misalA (however it's spelt) and lamb vindalo (however it's spelt). I enjoyed the chicken, the lamb was mediocre.. the rice serving is small.... we asked for another order of rice, They instead gave us an additional serving of rice on the house. 

The view on the second floor overlooks the airport. 

I would visit again!

I was going to tip more.. but when I gave them my bill.. they decided to not give back the change?? We waited for it to come back so I could tip them more but when we realize they weren't gonna come back... it turned us off... so we left without tipping them the additional we would have given them.. :/

The location is awesome on the second floor if your a fan of planes you can watch the planes land & take off while you eat. . . Pretty awesome view I came here for the buffet WOW for $12 I had two full helpings the food was amazing a lil spicy for me but I never could handle spicy food let's just say I drank 2 full glasses of water but the food was good tho lol spicy or not they had a wide selection of food the staff was very helpful especially because I can't pronounce anything on the menu. They explained what everything was I had Indian food numerous of times but never went to the buffet alone great price great location friendly staff

This was the first time we visited Pure and we were very impressed.
The restaurant looks out at the airport, so the view of planes landing
makes for a beautiful sight.  The food was delicious.  We had the
chicken jalfrezzi and the lamb vindaloo.   Both the chicken and lamb
were as tender as I can remember at an Indian restaurant and the
sauces were also excellently prepared.  The garlic naan and the
basmati rice (which comes with the entree) were also very
flavorful.   Go there.  You won't be disappointed.
Naan was homemade and amazing! Recommend paneer tikka masala and veggie samosa. Lunch buffet is a great deal, too. Amazing view, friendly staff, delicious food!

Dinner experience.**
In my opinion, the portions were small and the price was high. $17 for maybe 10 pieces of meat in the chicken tikka masala. They also gave us 2 plates of rice for 3 entrees. 

The service started off ok, but towards the end we were neglected. There was a Yelp coupon for a "free samosas with the purchase of 2 entrees", we were unable to click on the coupon from an Android and iPhone so the waiter took this opportunity to ignore the deal. When we showed him that it wasn't pulling up, he said he would look into it. He never did... 

We were a party of 3 adults and 3 toddlers (2 year olds). The toddlers didn't order any additional food from their menu, SO I guess they made up for the lost revenue by adding a 15% (large party) gratuity to our bill. I had added a take out order to my bill and the 15% was added to the take out order. 

This place was good, but I would probably not go back. The way that they handle business really turned me away.

Awesome food and awesome service. I had the chicken Vinaloo was delicious and my girlfriend had the Lamb Tikka Masala, which she loved. I also was able to use my Groupon and get quite a bit off. Nikita was our server and she was very attentive.

Been here a few times! The view is beautiful overlooking the airport and strip. The price for All You Can Eat ($9.99) Lunch is great! The food is very good. Very satisfying- we live in Henderson so the location is perfect for us! The garlic naan was some of the best I've ever had - baked to perfection, crispy, soft, so thin, lots of garlic.....Yummy!
Great service, great view....apps were tasty, ordered mild and my stomach was burning from the inside out.  Don't know if it was me or the food.  Haha, would definitely go back.

Don't let the location of this little Indian gem fool you. It's across from the airport, in an industrial looking building, up on the second floor. But once inside the ambiance is lively and its fun to watch the planes. When we arrived I was delighted to see All Indian patrons. I love Indian food and seriously - this is the best I've ever had. The lamb biriani melts in your mouth, on a bed of extraordinary rice with cashews and veggies. The butter chicken is so tender i don't know how they did it, with a sauce i could eat every day. Palak paneer, my most favorite dish, was hands down the star of the meal. 

Go here and try the good. I'll be back every time I'm in Vegas.

This is a one star because there is a stocky build guy who works the dining room and does not care about food allergies at all.  To him it's nothing more then a big joke.

My wife likes the food here, the few times prior to this visit the food for me was good as well.  Normally we've had one of the female servers who do listen to customer needs and made sure the kitchen made my food properly.

On this visit however, after several dishes were served to include the rice and we started eating, I immediately noticed an issue.  We called the waiter over and asked him if there was cinnamon in the rice and/or anything else?  He said yes.  Really??? Cinnamon in jasmine rice as well as other dishes?  We all looked at him in disbelief stating we told you there was a cinnamon allergy.  His response?  You've been here before for the lunch Buffett, did you eat the rice and other stuff that time?  Really?  You don't deserve to be working here.

Our response...we asked what dishes on the Buffett had cinnamon that day and they took the time to ask the chef.  As I was headed out the door to try and get medicine to counter act the allergy, I noticed the girl staff yelling at him for not checking and taking this seriously.  It was a very rough night that came very close to the ER.  He's lucky he's not facing a law suit, he was just rude and did not care.  My wife says he seemed to feel bad and took 10% off the bill and gave her free desert, really?

My wife likes the food here and it's good for her dietary needs so I will take her back if she so desires however, I will NEVER eat here again as I do not feel I can trust this place to take food allergies seriously.  Luck of the draw on servers does not work for me.
Excellent food & service! Overlooking the airport airplane traffic is an additional treat.

Best Indian food in Vegas yet by far! Great views . The food was fantastic. Service is a little slow but to be expected with a new restaurant. We have been to many in Vegas and have been soo disappointed until now. This is a must try! Our server was Kriti very nice and she was very attentive.
Friendly and sweet staff, very good food. The best kheer i ever had!!! Little costly though but overall totally recommend it!
Excellent service  delicious food will return on my next trip , it is a little off the strip but well worth the drive or taxi ride.. Totally recommend this place 100
Typical Indian service, as in Lousy (disorganized), but hey the food was great. Their naan comes out fresh and crispy how I like it. Try it out!
Fantastic food. Vegetable samosa was very good. Definitely going on my list of Las Vegas stops.

Me and my boyfriend were craving Indian food, so we decided to come here for a late night dinner after shopping. Checked Yelp for the hours of operation & fortunately enough, they close at 3am. We kinda got lost on which building in the complex it was because it was dark out and the sign they had outside wasn't very visible unless you're really looking for it. 

The restaurant is upstairs, where we passed by a hookah lounge (which I believe has the same owner as the restaurant). Came in and was greeted by the staff. The guy let us pick our own table, especially because there was only one other table there at the time. 

They provide an appetizer of thin bread with a green and brown dip. I personally preferred the brown one for the crackers/bread. We ordered: 
Chicken Tandoori - it's a big "appetizer" which we ate as an entree. Try it with the green dip that came with the thin bread appetizer 
Chicken Masala - great with rice. All their entrees come with rice. It's $3 more for each extra order of rice. 
Both our orders were definitely five stars! They were delicious and full of flavor. The two were plenty for the both of us. 

I appreciate the most: the view of the restaurant. I enjoy watching the planes land, so the view was great.Especially at night. There was also live music there and an open bar. 
Improvement: it was a little hard communicating with the staff so it caused us to ask so many questions and ask for items every time they came back.

We dined at this restaurant on a weekday. It was not very busy so we secured a prime table next to a window overlooking the runways at McCarran airport. In short order papadum and a cilantro chutney were delivered to the table along with our menus and glasses of water.  Our order included garlic naan, butter chicken, basmati rice and lamb saag.  There was not much protein in either entree and the naan seemed dry, but the saag was above average.  Like many Indian restaurants, the luncheon buffet offers much better value without sacrificing much in the way of quality.
Manager was unpleasant.

Been here a number of times for lunch and dinner.  The wait staff was quite welcoming and friendly.  Food was top notch -- as good as I've had anywhere (I've been to around 8 Indian places).  Chairs, table, and dishwares are high quality.  You have a nice view to the mountains or strip from a window table.  Prices are in line with other Indian restaurants, considering that rice is included with the entries.

Not sure why people like it here. I'm definitely not going back. The location is odd. The restaurant is oddly set up and the buffet seems a little dirty. The service is lack luster and I can't say I found any of it very tasty. I prefer Mint Bistro and probably any of the other Indian places I've been seem to be cleaner and friendlier.

Disappointed with the Butter Chicken, there is more flavor in the frozen dish you can buy  from Trader Joe's, also the quantity I received for 16 dollars was insufficient. The Dal soup was bland and somewhat sad compared to what I've eaten before. My appetizer and Mango Lassi were good but sad to say if I'm buying, I would not eat here again.

Indian cuisine is an interesting category on Yelp. I feel as though a lot of non-Indians in certain parts of the U.S. really haven't experienced truly outstanding Indian food, so they don't have much of a frame of reference when reviewing Indian restaurants.

If you ate at Pure and felt you had great Indian food, then you're going to be truly blown away when you finally do eat great Indian food. You didn't have it at Pure though.

As someone who's lived in India and also eaten some of the best Indian food in the U.S., I continue to be extremely disappointed by the quality of the Indian food offerings in Las Vegas. Overall, Indian cuisine lags far behind many other ethnic cuisines in the City.

Pure is somehow a 2-3-star restaurant with a 4.5-star rating on Yelp, which is very misleading in my opinion. Many of the curries, which should be more distinctive, are just slight variations of the chicken tikka masala, which is average.

I've had 4-5 of their curries, including the butter chicken, korma and vindaloo, and all were average at best. If I had to pick one, I'd go with the butter chicken.

The quality of their naans and rotis is poor. The samosas were average. The soups were not authentic. 

If you eat at Pure, notice that there's an Indian banquet hall in the same shopping center that attracts large numbers of Indian clientele, yet very few Indians eat at Pure. Indians do not like to pay a lot of money for mediocre Indian food, which is unfortunately what you get at Pure.

From out of town and was looking for good Indian food. Scored with this place. Manny and Natalie were THE BEST. Food was fresh and delicious. Chicken Tikka Masala was some of the best I've ever had. They even learned it was my birthday and brought me cake. So friendly, so delicious. We will definitely be back next time we are in town.
Great food, great service. The booths were comfortable. The Chicken biryani was delicious as was their naan. Looking forward to going there again after my next trip, so close to the airport.

My boyfriend and I drive past this place often and decided to go in one freezing night and I don't regret it. The staff were very attentive, the hookah was smooth, the food was delicious, and the drinks was a bit strong so you will get your money's worth off just one lol. For the food we had fries, lamb chops, and hot wings (all 3 were cooked to perfection). Oh yes and I can't forget about the incredible view as we dined like a queen and king. No complaints!
The food is amazing, there is a wonderful view of the strip, and the live music was incredible.

Delicious food. Well worth a visit. Plenty of flavour and portions are good. A little away from the strip but it was the best decision we made to travel out. 
The place looks very clean and trimmed out with good furniture.the staff are friendly and our waitress never let our water get below half the glass.
The food is excellent. I enjoy the taste and quality of the food. There is a also a good view of Las Vegas and the airport.
I've gotten take out twice from here and loved it both times. Butter chicken is the best.

This place is great. The chicken tikka masala was amazing and it came with naan and beautiful rice. The hookah was surprisingly well hitting and our server Mani was very courteous. The view is a nice touch, I would definitely come here again.

I placed my order through Yelp/ Grub Hub and waited 55 minutes only to receive the main food minus the rice. I called the restaurant and was told I had to deal with Grub Hub even though I feel it was the restaurants fault since they are the ones that package the food up to go out. 
I called GrubHub who called the delivery driver and then The restaurant. The restaurant admitted they didn't send it and would credit me for the missing rice from the 4-5 items. My credit given is $3.24! I guarantee if I ordered 2 sides of rice my total would be more than that. I wouldn't be upset but this is the 2nd time this has happened to me at this establishment and the last time I picked it up myself so it is not a delivery person issue. It is a restaurant issue. 
When I spoke with the guy at restaurant he didn't really care. 
The  food taste ok which is why I gave 2 stars. I am known to stop and just pick up Naan as a snack for my children at the restaurant but that won't be happening from now on.
Very good value. Not the best indian food ive ever had, but def the best indian buffet ive ever had. Fresh and full of flavor
Great prices and great food!  We come here every time we come to Vegas. It beats anything we've had on the Strip!

There's nothing I can say about this place in a negative light. Indian music, nice waitresses, and the food?....to die for. 
This was my first time trying Indian cuisine and i assure you it won't be the last. If you ever plan to visit this place, you must try the Aloo Tikki, Vegetable pakora for appetizers and for the entre, order the Navaratan Korma. It's so good you will melt In your seat. Oh and be sure to let them know that you want it mild (unless you have a high tolerance for spicy food) I don't so getting the mild was perfect for me. 
As if the ambience itself wasn't enough, you look outside and there is the beautiful strip with airplanes zipping across on the runway. 

Just as we were departing, a woman joined the band and started singing in one of the most beautiful voices I've heard in a while. Come here to relax and eat like a king. 

The best part about this whole experience is that it's only about 10 minutes from me. So I will definitely return.
Excellent food! We were very impressed. Staff was friendly and attentive. So many options we will have to return many time to sample the rest.

Solid Indian food. Top ten lunch buffet in Las Vegas.

I've eaten Indian food in North America, Africa, Europe, and Asia (four different continents).  While I've had better (and more expensive) Indian cuisine, Pure Indian punches above it's weight. I'm disappointed by reviewers complaining about the food selection. The lunch buffet features all the staple dishes, pakodas, rice, tandoori chicken, daal or lentil soup, vegetable masala, crisp garlic naan, etc. 

I've been hosted by several Indian families over the years. Dishes like chicken tikka masala are put out to appease an American palette. I stick to the core menu. It's delicious and satisfying. I could easily eat here everyday without getting bored.

The panoramic views of the airport are a bonus. I come here for the food.

Today was our second visit to Pure. I can't believe every table isn't filled with food like this. My wife and I have visited nearly every Indian restaurant in town, and this is one of two that stand head and shoulders above the rest. If you want to come to an outstanding Indian restaurant, come here.

First time here and we love Indian food. New to Vegas and didn't know where to go. Found a Groupon so we thought we'd try it. The food is amazing. Authentic. Really good. Great view of planes taking off at the airport. Not a ton of ambiance but the great food makes up for that.
Excellent food and service!!! Highly recommended. The view is outstanding, we watched the airplanes take off and land. Ask for Mani, he is an amazing waiter!!
Definitely not that good. The naan is terrible. It's thick and doughy and no butter on top. Disappointed that they didn't have dahl. Will continue going to Origin of India.

Great food, great view, great service! We had the best shrimp vindaloo, lamb saag, and chicken Tikka saag. We were seated quickly and everyone was super friendly. The meal came out fast as well. Great for date night!!!

Absolutely delicious! We got the butter chicken, tika masala chicken, and garlic naan. Butter chicken was my favorite but it is all so good! You can watch the planes land as you eat with a view of the strip in the background.. And live music starting at 7pm. They also have a hookah lounge and a huge ballroom for events. Awesome experience! We will be back.

- Chicken tikka masala: awesome!
- Palak paneer: good.
- Naan: good, not great. Fresh and warm. Too thin for me.
- Service: fine, but a little abrupt.
- The portions were pretty big, although I thought there wasn't enough rice and bread for the amount of entree, which is always a bit frustrating.
- Price was $15-$20 per entree, which I was fine with given the quality and portions.
- Water was room temperature and didn't have ice :/
- Atmosphere: pretty nice. It's across from the airport and you can see planes landing. It's at the second floor of an office building, which doesn't bother me, but I've never seen a restaurant like that before.

The low down

Location: easy to get to on Sunset Rd about 5 minutes east of the Strip. The restaurant is on the 2nd floor over looking the McCarran runway. Kind of cool of cool to watch the planes take off and land. As the sun goes down you can get a decent view of the strip. Their signs aren't the most prominent so being able to notice it while driving by may be a little hard. They are directly above a Kabob restaurant.

Ambiance: very clean and and nice looking. kind of open with a lot of windows. We ate there for dinner an got there before sunset. They had shades pulled down on the west side to keep the sun out of our eyes. The only drawback as it started to get dark outside was their light. Although there isn't much they can do without spending a ton of money but they utilized the fluorescent lighting in the ceiling. Most of the fixtures were covered with blue panels but there were a few that weren't. One being right above out table. Which turned out to be bright and obnoxious. They might want to use a warmer type of lighting. There was a man with a keyboard playing live music which was quite pleasant. I'm not sure how often he is there. 

Food: we ordered Chicken Saag, Chicken vindaloo , garlic naan and rice. The Naan had a great flavor and slightly thicker than normal. The Vindaloo was awesome. I think I might have ordered it a little too spicy but I was able to handle it. The Saag was the best that both me and my girlfriend had ever had. The naan seemed to be very pillowy and fresh. All in all. Extremely good food.

Update: we went back a few days later because we wanted to try the buffet. All items that I tried were delicious. Especially the Butter Chicken and Palak Paneer. The chicken tandoori was slightly on the dry side but flavor was very good. And there were other delicious items that I don't remember the names.
Very delicious food. Loved the buffet. Samosa's are small but super tasty. As a vegetarian Indian I can say they have good cook. Restaurant is neat and clean.

We Ordered matar paneer, chicken jalfarezi, chicken tikka masala.
Very tasty and had a home cooked taste.
Owner is very humble and nice and he offered us free mojito drinks after the meal as well
Highly Recommended :)

If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would in a hot second. Ever since I tried Indian food for the first time last month in New York, I have had cravings for this amazing cuisine. I was so worried I would not find a place in Las Vegas. So I asked my friends and read reviews on yelp. I stumbled upon this hidden gem. Mani was 
a fantastic server. He helped us pick the items I described from the menu. The view from our table was of the airport runway and quite entertaining.  I can't wait to tell everyone I found the this spot. I am so happy that I found a place that by far exceeded my expectations. These items are a must order...chicken Tikka Masala,
Garlic Naan, Dal Makhani, Chicken Tikka, and don't forget the rice pudding. The service was just as good as the food. I no longer have to travel to NY for what is now my favorite cuisine. You won't be disappointed with this place.

Amazing food and service!!!! Mr. Rohan was very helpful and greeted us with a big smile on his face.
Gobi adraki is a must try! Also the kheem naan! The best part is the ambience. Clear and spectacular view of the las vegas runway!!!
Have your beer and enjoy the view!!!
The service was also great. Rohan, who took care of our table was very pleasing, had the complete menu knowledge and his suggestions were worth giving it a shot. He exactly knew about what we were looking for and suggested accordingly. 
One of our best experiences ever with indian food in las vegas.
Do try the ras malai there! It's delicious. 
If you are in las vegas and are looking for indian food, please visit this restaurant . You wont be disappointed. Cheers

Lived in Las Vegas for 56 years. I've eaten at a lot of places. I was thrilled at how delicious this food is. The Menu is a bit hard to decipher but with the help of the charming waitress I decided on a Chicken curry dish with a buttery sauce (Chicken Tiki Marsala *not sure about the spelling.) WOW! Excellent portions, chicken was tender. I asked for spicy, it was not unpleasantly hot.  Lots of perfect rice. More then enough to take home left overs. We ate  at 4 pm, after the buffet had ended to avoid any rush. The restaurant is on the 2nd floor and over looks the airport runways with the Strip in the background. It's clean and pleasantly decorated with a full bar. We took our time and never felt rushed or ignored. The only thing is it was in the middle of summer and about 116 that afternoon. They needed to boost the air conditioning as the food was hot and so was the weather. I can't wait to visit again.

I tried this Indian restaurant and Mani and Kriti served me. They explained the buffet showing me the vegetarian and non vegetarian buffet. For 9.99 I can't complain. The jeera rice is awesome. I came back at night to try the hookah. Probably the only view like this for a hookah lounge. It overseas the Las Vegas strip and the airport. Watch planes and eat food or smoke hookah. I'll be back

I went here to try the buffet. The food was okay. The only thing I really enjoyed was the view and the garlic Naan. Otherwise, the food tasted average. Price was good and so was the service. I probably wouldn't dine here again.

This is our second visit to Pure and it was delicious again. This time we had:
Chicken Tikka Masala
Lamb Tikka Masala
Chicken Vindaloo
Garlic Naan
Vegetable Samosa
Paneer Korma
I really enjoyed the Tikka Masala dishes. Really creamy and flavorful. Next time I'll try the Spicy heat instead of Medium.

Very tasty food, and amazing to get a nice meal like this at 1am!!  Had the basics butter/vindaloo/korma and they were all tasty.  Will absolutely try a few of their other dishes and try the buffet during a lunchtime.  Ordered medium and they were are very tame on the heat, so I will go hot next time.

Delicious food, reasonable prices and great service!  Mani is a great manager and really takes care of the customers.

Food is delicious - don't skip the chai tea, so good.

Portions are generous :0)

Rarely do I give 5-star reviews but this place is great! The spices are just right. The flavor is complex and lively. The portions are very reasonable. It's a little pricey compared to what I'm used to paying for Indian food but so worth it. We tried our favorite dishes - chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, palak paneer, and dal tadka. All of them were great. Often dal is watery but there's was perfect. Good consistency and great spice flavor. The chicken tikka masala was probably the best I've had. The tomato flavor shined through without being overpowering. And both palak paneer and butter chicken were above average. The place is hard to find. There isn't clear signage and when you walk in it would be hard to tell it's necessarily a restaurant. The decor is bizarre for any restaurant but the food is so good. Definitely worth a trip out to the airport!
Delicious food at very affordable prices. Plenty of vegan options, the staff is pretty knowledgeable about them. It's open late which is always appreciated. And that view! Can't beat it!

Very good food, a little salty but great customer service.  I hope they continue the good work -- only open 2 months!

Great views of the city!

PS Parshant is a very friendly waiter

If you come here on the weekend at 3 pm for the lunch buffet.
Its worth it, despite the fact only 3 things are edible and the rest is personal preference.

The Butter Chicken,  The Chicken Tandoori, The Garlic Nan.
You also get a choice of beverage, I just get the refillable soda.

If you come at any other time, Ordering a la carte is even better than buffet sometimes but you have to know what is what.  You can't be an Indian Foodie Newb because once you get it, you're committed. They don't sell combination things or whatever,  you pick the stew with the "Indian protein" of your choice and you better like it.  There are no photos, so ask ask ask, because a vindaloo, a korma, a curry and a Tikki masala are worlds apart. 

If you've had indian food and like it, this place makes good food.
If you've never tried indian food before, it might not be for you but that doesn't mean this place didn't make it right.

Hands down, the best Indian food in Vegas!

Food 5/5- We ordered the chicken vindaloo and the chicken Karahi with garlic naan. Spice level is made to order and if you want to sweat, this is the place for you. 

Drinks 4/5- Good selection of Indian beers as well as full bar. 

Hookah 4+/5- Good variety of flavors; just make sure to ask for the larger coals. 

View 5+/5- GREAT view of the strip and an amazing place to watch the sunset. 

Service 5/5- Very attentive waitstaff that is quick to respond to any request! Ask for Nikita or Raj!

Overall, if you are craving AMAZING Indian food you NEED to check this place out!

Beautiful views, open and spacious. You must try their Salted lassi and masala tea. There isn't much else though. We ordered samosa chat, Lasuni Gobi, Rotis, Paneer Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken, Dal Makhni and none of it was good. Lasuni Gobi was limp and soggy, Samosa Chat was spiked with too much Garam Masala and the dal was watery and without flavor and I dont have much to say about the Paneer and Chicken. 

I do have to say we received excellent service. The waitress who was serving us was polite, friendly and attentive. When she noticed the leftovers and food on our plates she got worried and asked after it. She also requested that we dont give a negative feedback on Yelp. If the owner's reading this, you know you have a keeper in her. And to the lady herself, sorry but I have to do this. I bank on the ratings I see on Yelp and have to be honest to my peers here.
Delicious food, phenomenal service, decent wine selection.  Will make this a regular stop.
Great service excellent people are warm and polite food is authentic for Indian food. View to die for complements the food.

The food was a tiny bit pricey (but we had a Groupon so it didn't matter) and the drinks were awful light, but otherwise have no complaints. The service was great. Food was excellent. Good, solid Punjabi style Indian food. Would definitely go back.

Thought it was ok. First experience in Las Vegas w/ buffet style Indian cuisine, used to more of a family style. 
There was a large family there that kept cutting in and out of the line like it didn't matter at all so it was chaotic, coming up for seconds etc. so that lessened the experience. The food was pretty decent. I would try it again but prefer not to deal with a similar experience in the line for the buffet. The cost was $11.99 + tax so it came to $12.97 for lunch at about 1pm.

Great Indian food and an awesome view of the strip.   My favorite is the paneer tikka masala, which has a kind of Smokey flavor unlike any other indian place in town.  My wife loves the paneer pakoras.  The malai kofta is also good.

Also on some nights this electronic jazz singer  named Miko Montgomery comes and I really dig his beats.

Nice establishment here. My wife and I grabbed a Groupon to check out this place and came here last night for dinner since we both love Indian food. I got the Lamb Korma with 9/10 spice level and my wife got the Chicken Vindaloo with 8/10 spice level.

Both dishes tasted excellent perfect combination of Indian spices and flavors. They certainly lived up to the level 9 heat level as my nose was running halfway thru my meal. Only drawback is that they only gave us one small saucer of rice to split for both of our meals but the waitress was nice enough to give us a little more rice complementary upon request.

Service was good. Our waitress was friendly and the food came out in a reasonable time but it wasn't busy in there when we were in there so it's hard to tell how they perform when busy. Otherwise, nice place to visit if you want some Indian food.
Loved the Briyani Lamb!  Curries were excellent too. Mani was wonderful and helpful in ordering. We loved the musician too -Miko Montgomery!

Food was amazing. My husband and I started with the Tandoori Fish appetizer. The fish was fluffy and flavorful. It didn't need any sauce, it was awesome by itself. We then ordered Lamb tikka masala(lamb curry), Chicken tikka masala(chicken curry), with Garlic naan(separately). The portions looked small, but it filled us up just right. The food was so amazing we had to end our course with dinner. We ordered the Gulab Jamun (mini donut holes soaked with glaze) and it was amazing. They only give you two donuts, I wished they served more because it was so delicious.
We are definitely coming back to show our friends and family.
I would hav said something if it's worth saying. A bad bad hole in the wall with a rude person

Yummy! I can't believe this place has been so close to both my house and work for so long and I haven't been here. My boyfriend was craving Indian and he found a groupon. Saw that the reviews were pretty good so we decided to check it out.

First, the place is super clean and has an amazing view of both the airport as well as the strip. We are already talking about coming back and timing it to catch the sunset. 

The service we had was impeccable! Everyone was great but especially our server Mani who was incredibly attentive to our needs throughout dinner. Very friendly and helpful!

We started with some drinks and samosas. Then we moved on to some tikka masala, vindaloo and garlic naan. Everything was excellent and nice portions which is important to me since I love leftovers!

Prices were very reasonable but an even better deal if you can still score the groupon. Looking forward to coming again soon!to coming
